All Reviews

  1. This item fogged up the moment I turned my shower on. Do not waste your money like I did!
  2. This may be the first truly &#34;fogless&#34; mirror I've had! It's a bit of a nuisance to fill it with hot water each time, and the squeegee is not terribly effective, but overall it permits me to shave comfortably in the shower. The razor rest on the bottom is quite handy.
  3. Not worth $40. More like about $20. Light is pretty useless. Fog-less part works.
  4. Amazing product. Perfect solution. Love the LED lights and no fog. Crystal clear and easy to install.
  5. So far so good. The mirror comes with silicone to glue to the wall but I drilled a couple of small holes in the mounting bracket and used some drywall mollys to mount in my tiled shower stall. Works great. Has not fogged yet and is a very clear image.
  6. ***UPDATED REVIEW 12/8/14*** After receiving a faulty unit initially (see old review below) I reordered and checked the new one over, not finding the flaw I did with the first. Mounting was easy and simple enough with the pre-attached adhesive strips and tube of silicone. I cleaned the side of the wall where this would go and mounted according to the instructions, waiting 24 hours before attaching the mirror itself. This is the second shower mirror I've ever had and I'm an avid Headblader, so I'm using a razor on my face or head nearly every time I'm in the shower. The first mirror was round (~5 in diamter) with a covered LED strip around the edges (dim) and a hanger for the razor below (flimsy, doesn't fit all razors); it was mounted using suction cups (which would fail, loudly) and had some kind of anti-fogging chemical applied (which worked for about a month but prevented cleaning afterwards). I won't waste any more time on the deficiencies of that unit, but wanted to include that as narrative for this review. While only installed for a couple of weeks now, it feels solidly mounted to the wall. The mirror is nice and large and offers some magnification. The LED is bright enough to shave from when the bathroom lights are dimmed low, something that can happen on early mornings for me. Filling the reservoir is a MUST to prevent fogging - it's how it works - and I've had no issues with fogging at all. The attached squeegee can remove water drops easily to keep the surface clear. Just a couple of minor gripes, though. While the LED is bright, you really are only using reflected light on your face. This necessitates me having to lean in very close to the mirror for the LED to light my face or head (not an issue when the lights in the bathroom are on full). Putting the reservoir back in place can be a bit tricky unless you press your face against the side of the shower wall - it would be nice if it were a little easier (maybe experience or more than 2 weeks will do it?). Finally, the platform beneath the mirror (the box shows a razor laying on it) is much closer to the bottom of the mirror than that picture indicates. A bit more room would make it easier getting hands on/off the razor. In all I'm very pleased with this mirror compared to my previous one. ***OLD REVIEW*** Upon receiving (which was as timely as ever) I unboxed and looked everything over to make sure there were no glaring issues. I noticed the battery cover seemed to have been assembled incorrectly or improperly labeled. The screw tops were plastic and large enough for fingers and were keyed with a triangle, designed to be a guide to lock or unlock the battery compartment with a simple quarter of a turn. I noted that one of the screwtops was oriented correctly, pointing at the lock that was closed; the other was 180 degrees off. I turned the mislabeled one first in the direction that it should go to unlock and it did - other side worked as well. I placed the batteries and put the cover back on and tightened one screw down, but the misaligned one from earlier didn't budge - I had placed it in the \\"correct\\" position per the diagram, opposite what it had been. I switched it back to where it was oriented and attempted to tighten it down and the screwtop snapped freely from the metal screw it was attached to. I returned to Amazon, but was a bit dismayed that I could only return and get a refund, not do an exchange.
  7. I was so excited to give this to my husband for his birthday. When I finally had time to mount it to the smooth glass shower enclosure wall, I took extra care to follow the directions for prepping the surface with an alcohol prep pad and keeping the shower dry over a weekend to ensure it would stay securely attached. We have hard, ceramic tile floors and if the mount failed, I was certain the mirror would be toast. My hub loved the mirror. It's nice and bright and the pivot made it easy for me to see into it as well, and I'm a foot shorter than my husband--okay, on my tiptoes. Six or seven months later, I found the mirror on the floor, broken, with all the silicone still on the glass enclosure. So, although liked the mirror very much and it definitely stayed fog free I'm disappointed that it didn't stay securely fasten to the wall. The mirror and lighting, however, really great! Unfortunately, we're back to a small, suction cup attached mirror.
  8. The mirror pops off the mount WAY too easily. I bought it for my husband for Father's Day, he seems to like it, but every time he goes to squeegee it off after his shower, it pops off the mount and totally irritates him. It's a shame, because it's an otherwise great product. If you can live with it jumping off the wall, go for it. It's good size, lights up well, does the trick, but that's a major flaw that the manufacturers need to adress in future design.
  9. I purchased for Father's Day for my boyfriend and I love it! I may be obsessed with it! I constantly make funny faces at myself in the shower. He loves it also of course.
  10. Works as described... squeegee is nice touch

I can only give it two stars because with the warping it doesn't achieve the main function, being a flat mirror, well at all.

  23. I've purchased a number of shower mirrors over the years. They've all been pretty horrible, overall. After reading the reviews on this particular mirror I decided to pull the trigger.<br /><br />I have no been disappointed. It is fog free, I love that it has the light built in, and its large!<br /><br />The only real downside I've seen so far is the way it mounts. For textured surfaces in the shower, this mounting does not seem to work very well. After 2 weeks it is already starting to come off. I am going to use some industrial strength silicone to see if that helps.<br /><br />My biggest complaint is the price. $50 is crazy expensive for this thing. It's all plastic, and I'd be willing to bet that manufacturing of this item isn't expensive.
  24. My wife and I have purchased numerous \\"fogless\\" mirrors in the past, paying anywhere from $15-$40, only to realize the \\"foglessness\\" is only temporary in nature... and almost never longer than 3 months.<br /><br />While we've only had this one for a bit over a month, it appears to be the real deal. Takes 20 seconds or less in the shower to fill the water cavity with fresh hot water. Build quality is far superior to any other that we've purchased. The light with two intensity settings is a really nice touch. The squeegee is another neat feature but, it could be better sized to matched the mirror (minor gripe).<br /><br />So far, well worth the few extra bucks over its competitors. In this case, it would seem that you really do get what you pay for. Recommended buy.<br /><br />Update: 6/28/12 - Have used this mirror for just over 4 months. Still loving the features above. Still fogless. Original batteries still have life left in them. One additional minor gripe is that after the cavity on the unit is filled with water and rehung onto the base, the mirror has enough weight that it sometimes wants to tip downward... but it is easily readjustable to the preferred position, and holds firm as long as you don't touch it.<br /><br />After 4 months with other mirrors, I would be cussing them each and every morning as I squirm about the shower trying to find that one spot on the mirror that I can see enough of my face to properly shave.<br /><br />Update: 11/02/12 - The bracket no longer holds the weight of the mirror when filled with water, as the tilt mechanism has given out. So now, I have to hold the mirror in one hand and shave with the other.... or else bend over to shave. Either way, I am disappointed. Update my review from 5 to 2 stars. Thought I would get what I paid for... guess I was wrong.<br /><br />Update: 5/24/13 - ToiletTree Products contacted me about the concerned that I was experiencing with the tilt mechanism on my mirror, and offered to replace it free of charge. They have apparently changed the design or construction in some way to make the mechanism more durable. I received the replacement tilt mechanism, and installed in about 1 minute... quick and easy! My mirror is like new again! Thanks to the ToiletTree Products team for taking care of the customer. I will definitely consider purchasing from these folks again in the future.eplace it free of charge. They have apparently changed the design or construction in some way to make the mechanism more durable. I received the replacement tilt mechanism, and installed in about 1 minute... quick and easy! My mirror is like new again! Thanks to the ToiletTree Products team for taking care of the customer. I will definitely consider purchasing from these folks again in the future.

  28. I love shaving in the shower where I can wash my face in hot soapy water, then applying lather and, with the mirror very close, very clear, and with the lights on shave with my Gillette Power Fusion razor which buzzes and vibrates while I shave. To work well you need to take the mirror off the mount, pour out the cold water in the reservoir, fill it with hot water and remount the mirror. It takes 15 seconds.<br />Warning. This is made of light and somewhat fragile plastic. Do not try to mount the rack to the wall with anything but silicone adhesive (supplied). I tried the tape and it fell off, cracked, the lights no longer worked, and now I'm on my second mirror.<br />Also, this may need to be light weight, but I wish they would make a metal and glass version of this product. I would pay more, and I think it would look better.<br />One minor complaint: I don't care for the ToiletTree logo and name on the top of the mirror.<br />I looked long and hard on the internet for a better product and could not find it.

  46. Last year I reviewed the Original ToiletTree Fogless Shower Mirror and loved it. I didn't really think they could improve upon it, but they have! There are now LED lights around the frame that you turn on with a quick push of a button.It is also just a tad bigger than the original fogless shower mirror.<br /><br />The ToiletTree LED Fogless mirror uses a silicone glue substance that you stick on your tile and then you attach the mirror, and it is holding it. I have had it up now for awhile and it is not going anywhere! I also don't think I will have a problem removing the mirror if I want to as the silicone seems pretty flexible and is clear so it won't leave a residue. To use the mirror all you have to do is lift it off, fill it with hot water and snap it back on. The hot water is the trick as that is what keeps it from fogging up! Then if you do get spots on it or didn't fill it with hot water, just use the attached squeegee to wipe it clean. The shelf that is included also holds at least 2 razors so it is a nice size shelf.<br /><br />Overall, this ToiletTree makes the best fogless mirrors that I have seen so far and I really do recommend it. So far it is working great for us and with features like an adjustable frame, LED lights, shatter proof, rust proof, easily attaches to tile, and a shelf, the mirror just keeps getting better! Perfect for shaving facial hair or even tweezing a few strays!
  47. There is a HUGE difference between shaving 2 feet from your bathroom mirror over the sink and using this illuminated shower mirror... This mirror is crystal clear and there's no chance this things going to fog. I've been using it for a week now; I've always shaved AFTER the shower.. I'll never do it again! I am able to get a much closer shave,Its almost like my fiances makeup mirror.. but in the shower. Here's a tip: If you shave mid-shower, you can shave against the grain and your skin wont get irritated due to all the moisture. Easy Set up.. Great Quality Product! I'm going to pick up a few more as Christmas Gifts..

  56. I have owned a similar product by Toilettree for about a year now, so I was quick to buy this when I saw it coming out. All of the great features the last one had a still there. The mirror attaches permanently to my shower wall (no suction cups) and does not fog when I fill the reservoir with hot water. They made a couple of big improvements that I think makes this worth the extra money. First off the light is awesome. No matter how long you have been shaving you need to be able to see what you are doing and this thing lights up the shower like I am playing in Yankee Stadium. The size of the mirror is also larger with this model, which is nice as you have to put your neck into awkward angles less frequently. I also think the little squeegee tool that they include for keeping it is a whole lot better. The old model would steak a little and this one really gets the mirror clean. Two years ago I had no idea these fogless products existed and now I can't live without them!
  57. I couldn't be happier with this mirror. After a few weeks, the adhesive is holding up great. The unit fits back on the \\"harness\\" without even really trying. I don't know how I ever shaved without this thing!
  58. Will never hang on tile in shower longer than a month or so. Used their adhesive per directions, 3 weeks and fell off wall. Tried more high powered adhesive, same issue. Company is cool, very communicative, product just doesn't hang.
  59. Not only a great product, but quick service from the company. Plus, they follow up with information and reminders for using the mirror. I am older and sit down to shower and the fog-less mirror makes shaving and showering a treat.
  60. This is by far the best fog free mirror I've used. It doesn't just rely on some coating that will eventually wear off. It uses simple science and works perfectly. My only complaint is the lighting helps but isn't great. Obviously this isn't a huge problem as long as there is adequate lighting and you just need a little bit more. I would definitely recommend this mirror without hesitation and would buy one again as a gift or for myself if the occasion ever presented itself.
  61. I have had this for about three months now and it works great. For many years I had a mirror which was connected to the shower, kept fog free by the water running through it. I was worried that filling this mirror with water would be a hassle or inefffective.<br /> Well, it works great. The mirror nicely attached to the ceramic tile. You can fill it up with water, but I just take the handheld shower and run it over the mirror a few seconds.It stays fog free, and has a great reflection. The mirror does not seem to get clouded as my old one did.<br /> Very good reflection for shaving, all in all worth the price.
  62. Son in law uses in shower and likes this mirror I gave as gift.
  63. So, I have always gotten serious folliculitis on my neck from shaving. Discovered years ago that if I shave in the shower like every three days, I get very little of it (if I shave every day, even using a fresh high end razor and gel for sensitive skin, my neck turns into a wasteland of infected ingrown hairs). Using a shower mirror makes it possible. The problem? I have never had a light in my shower. This thing is very awesome. If you cut easy, get lots of ingrown hairs, or it hurts to shave, try it in the shower and get yourself a good shave mirror like this one!!! Isn't cheap, but worth every penny so far.

  65. I usually do not give reviews for products, but felt I needed to this time. I have been using this mirror for a few months now, and the mirror works as advertised - does not fog up when you fill the reservoir with warm water. I really enjoy being able to shave in the shower and not have to worry about the mirror fogging up. However, after a few months of use the light stopped working. I thought I needed to replace the batteries, but when I did the light still does not work. Very disappointing. Luckily, there is enough light in the bathroom so this is not a major issue. But I specifically bought this model because it does have a light, and would expect it to continue working longer than the few months I have had it.
  66. I have bought and used every fog less shower mirror available and none compare to this one. The extra step to fill it with hot water keeps it from fogging up While you're showering. I would highly recommend this product.

  69. WOW ! I have had many shower mirrors, but this one takes the cake. My morning routine includes pouring out the old water and replacing it with hot shower water. I run the rubber blade across it, turn on the light, and I'm good to go. Shaving has become an enjoyable experience because of this mirror. Cheers ! to the manufacturer because I am truly happy with it.
  70. This product is terrific. I used a smaller stick-on model from another company for several years, and, although I got used to simply wiping the fog off it with a washcloth every day, finding it on the shower floor after the suction cups started failing got old very fast. The wife bought me a \\"fogless\\" unit from another manufacturer that attaches to the shower head and routes the water through the mounting tube to the mirror. A nice idea, but water is heavy, and after one or two attempts I could never get the mirror to stay where I put it - it always slumped down with the weight of the water. In addition, the extra joints would always leak a little. A cheap and ultimately useless design. So when I came upon this item I was intrigued. The adhesive idea is much better than suction cups or add-on plumbing, and the adhesive is even removable should the user decide to take it down. The mirror is bigger and the light better than the other units I had. Despite that, it was MUCH less bulky than the articulated model that wouldn't stay up. And there's not all that much room in our smallish shower. Filling the container up takes a little getting used to, but it became second nature after a few days. And the little squeegee is also cool. You can use the mirror alone without filling it, by just squeegee-ing it once or twice. Other than not having a radio or a clock (also a requirement in my shower), which I subsequently accomplished with a small separate hanging radio, there's nothing to dislike about this product. And very inexpensive to boot. Good job, ToiletTree!
  71. the mirror is not glass so you can't see really well and the lights are a nice idea they just are not bright enough and you better plan out where you put it because once its attached it can not be removed easily.
  72. Awesome this thing is great. Just refill it and no fog the only bad thing is that there is no adjustable light intensity. Only the on and off switch, because of this, the batteries go fast. I am lucky if it lasts more than a 3 weeks. This is with 2 person use. Cannot speak for the other person using it but I have the light on for about 15-20 minutes. Other than that this is awesome.
  73. I have had this mirror for approximately two years, and prior to that, I had the non-LED version of the mirror (which had worked great!). I followed the instructions and mounted the mirror in the shower. The adhesive that came with it failed after a few months, so I remounted it with a stronger adhesive and have not had any issues with it falling down since.<br /><br />This mirror works great except for one tragic flaw. The pivoting mechanism is woefully under-engineered. It fails immediately when filling the mirror with water. It is now to the point, even when it is empty, the slightest touch or bump with cause the pivot mechanism to fail and cause the mirror to point downward. At some point, I may try to modify the mirror myself to keep it locked in the perfect position.<br /><br />One other suggestion I have would be to drill a tiny hole (very tiny) to allow the water to slowly drain out. This would keep the water retained while showering, allowing the mirror to remain fog-free, but would empty it over the course of an hour or so, eliminating the need to empty it prior to filling with hot water again.<br /><br />Once again, this mirror is a great concept, it just needs to be beefed up to function as intended without failure.
  74. Thanks to Amazon I was able to find the only TRUE fogless mirror. I bucked up and bought the larger more expensive mirror with the LED lights and glad I did. The only reason this didnt recieve 5 stars because $50 is a lot to pay for a small mirror.<br /><br />THE KEY TO THIS PRODUCT IS ADDING THE WARM WATER IN THE MIRROR EACH TIME! I didnt realize this until about the 5th time trying it. Thankfully the company sent me an email to follow up on my purchase and included this little note in the email. I felt like an idiot since this is what truely makes it fogless and stays forgless for a long time. I have yet to take a shower long enough where the mirror actually fogged up. I imagine it would take about an hour if not more.<br /><br />Great product, great design, just a little pricey. I think $35 would be perfect for this.

  81. PRO: This shower mirror is OK - not \\"just barely OK\\" but a \\"nice\\" ok. It seems to be decently put together, and was easily installed (with clear instructions & needed supplies). How it will hold up as a mirror remains to be seen, as I just recently received it. It certainly functions as advertised and, given the simple principles upon which it works, should continue to do so. Tried letting it fog up with no water in the container, then filled it with the requisite warm water and it defogged rapidly, within just several seconds. The included squeegee slips readily into the molded holder. CONS: [1]The mirror is, frankly, dis-oriented by 90 degrees - it would be a whole lot more useful if the top to bottom dimension was the larger one - i.e., most people I know have faces that are longer than they are wide yet this mirror is oriented (and can't be changed) with the larger dimension going side to side. [2]The re-mounting once filled with water is adequate but you're doing it blindly since the mounting slot is on the back so it's a bit awkward. [3]The two-levels LED lighting only works, out of the box, on one intensity and is overall kinda useless - if you shower & shave in a pitch black room it'd likely be somewhat useful but in a regular shower with some ambient light it's useless and I certainly wouldn't pay the extra $20 for the light. [4] It'd also be better to have a hanging razor holder on the side of the attached bottom shelf, as it's rather awkward to fit and retrieve a razor from the shelf as is, squeezing in between the mirror's bottom edge and the squeegee holder; a molded holder at either end of the shelf would be better. [5]It's nowhere near as nice as the several mirrors I've had with a magnifying option (but then again, they had the stupid plumbing connection that corrodes and made them dysfunctional). All in all a decent mirror, worth the lower price ($30 without LED), that'll do nicely until something better comes along. (And way better made than thetotally junk ShowerTek model whose plastic plumbing connection broke while first being installed.)
  82. I would have thought I didn't like this, but I do.<br /><br />My kids teased me thinking &#34;oh... another thing from Amazon he'll never use&#34;<br /><br />Actually, really like this!<br /><br />If you have a shower on a hose, run warm water over it.. that will stop the fogging.

However, having said that, this product truly stands up to it's name. If you know that the reason your mirror fogs in the first place, that it is due to a difference in temperature; it is easy to fix. Find a way to keep the mirror the same temp as the shower. A water bath seems to be a good choice. The ToiletTree fogless mirror does that and doesn't fall. Great product !!!!

I really wanted to use the product because I knew it would work and that it was exactly what I wanted. However, at the time, they did not include a customer support phone number so I could request a replacement mounting kit.<br />I ended up returning the product and wrote a 4 star review - noting simply that their supplier sent some faulty silicone tubes and suggesting that they should include a customer service phone number so they could send me a $0.50 mounting kit, rather than having to return a $50 mirror. Within 2 hours of writing my review, on a Saturday morning, I received a note from the company's president noting that they had just started inserting a customer service phone number in their new packaging.<br />REVISED REVIEW - Since I received my new mirror, I have had no problems. It is easy to hang and I really like the clarity of the mirror while showering. It provides an excellent shower shaving experience. You need to fill up a small reservoir behind the mirror with water from the shower (which is what keeps it from fogging) but it is easy to fill, re-hang and dump after your shower. This is the first no-fog mirror I have used that I can recommend 100% and think it is a great addition to my shower. I also have to complement ToiletTree for their quick response to my issue. I am impressed how well they responded to my concern as well as how well they stand by their products.

  91. My hubby likes to have a clean-shaven face, life is much more convenient for both of us when he can use a mirror in the shower. For him, it is much better to be able to shower and shave at the same time, making his morning routine go by much faster. For me, I love the fact of not having to clean any hair out of the sink. It's a win win for both of us.<br /><br />The first thing we noticed when we received the ToiletTree LED Fog-less Shower Mirror was the new feature, the lights. Immediately, we knew this would help hubby even more. The shower is in the corner of the bathroom and it is a stand alone shower so it is pretty dim in there. Shaving can be a little risky, since you don't have much light. The mirror does not use suction cups which is a plus, meaning no sliding down, or simply falling off the wall altogether. The mirror requires adhesive which, for our old mirror, lasted well over 6 months and was still going strong. Although, you do have to allow the mirror to stand a full 24 hrs before using, which includes putting the mirror on it. The mirror is super easy to mount and fill with water. With my hubby and I being a foot different in height, it is really nice that the mirror has a tilt action. The shelf is perfect for hubby to set his razor on, plus I love the included squeegee which slides onto the shelf for easy storage. Also the LED has two different light settings, bright & dim, depending on what you need. My hubby couldn't be more content with his new mirror with LED Lighting.

  96. Very nice mirror - worked great the few times I used it until one of the plastic parts broke - the part which the mirror slides down onto and which clicks onto the wall piece and allows it to swivel up and down. Because some reviewers had a problem getting the wall mounting piece to stay attached to the wall, I carefully followed the directions and tips and got the mounting bracket firmly attached to the wall. Unfortunately, the plastic piece onto which the back of the mirror slides down on and allows it to &#34;ratchet&#34; up and down and click into a useable angle got a small crack after just a few uses and now the mirror can't click into and stay in a useable viewing angle. I realize this can happen with small plastic parts but I'm really disappointed that I can't use the mirror unless I can get a replacement part or remove and remount it higher up so It doesn't have to be angled up to be useable. I'm about ready to buy another one of these $50 mirrors. I've looked at many other &#34;top of the line&#34; options, but I still like this Toilettree mirror the best. While other brands also use use a warm water reservoir to keep the mirror fog free, I like the size of this mirror, the included squeegee with built-in holder, and that it has led lights that go all the way around it that stay on until i turn them off - not just two or three lights that time out in the middle of my shave.   120. Nice looking product, practical and the warm water idea to stop the mirror fogging up is effective, however my mirror did fall off the shower wall after a couple of months, think that was due to the mirror being taken on and off its cradle every day, movement etc. A better design would have been to put a small hole at the base of the mirror with a rubber stop so it can be drained after use without the need to take it off the cradle. You'd also need to use a small cup or similar to fill it under this scenario. If your taking the mirror off its cradle every day then I don't think the supplied double sided sticky foam and silicon adhesive are sufficient.
  121. I received this product as part of a blog giveaway and I gave it to my husband. He installed it with the included silicone in seconds, and it's so much more durable than the suction cups which never seem to work very long. He said (quote) \\"it makes shaving fun again.\\" He like how the swivel and the extra light make detailed shave swipes easier. You fill the back reservoir up with the hot shower water in just a few seconds. You can squeegee the water droplets off the mirror with the included squeegee which is nicely built into the shelf--just slide out and back in. It came with batteries which is always a plus. The LED light is a simple side push on-off button operated and is nicely bright. The shower isn't the best lit place in the bathroom with the curtain pulled, so it comes in handy.<br /><br />I would recommend remembering to dump the water out when you're done in the shower, otherwise, the next time you go to use it you end up dumping cold water on you whilst in a nice hot shower, which could be a bit unexpectedly frigid in winter house temperatures!
  122. its true to what they say does stay pretty fogless as long as you keep warm water in the back. but you must make sure you have the right material for it to stick to with the adhesive it doesn't work with all material.
  123. Think about it for a second. You're late for an important date and you need to get cleaned up and out of town. Who do you know, man or woman, who wants to fill the mirror up with hot water? Who would ever think of such a thing? And don't forget to drain the water out after you get done! This thing is a joke! Do yourself a favor and find one for 5 or 10 bucks and save some money.
  124. Clumsy, mounting side too big, difficult to use, you have to remove the mirror to add water to keep it fog less- not an easy feat. Overall takes up way too much space in shower. Very disappointed with this purchase. Do not understand the positive reviews at all.
  125. This mirror is exactly what was advertised. Stuck to our marble wall...no sliding off. Perfect size and the light is an added bonus. Only suggestion would be for the mirror to be magnfied...maybe 5x to 10x for us seniors who need it. Other than that, great product and I highly recommend it.
  126. I have used a couple other shower mirrors in the past and have been rather disappointed in either their ability to stay clear, or else they fell after just a couple months of use. I've had this up for about a month now and it works exactly how they claim. It uses a pair of adhesive pads, as well as silicon paste that comes with it. I don't know how well it comes off, but it has held quite well so far. As far as the mirror itself, you do need to fill it with hot water every use, which takes all of 5 seconds. After a quick wipe with the included squeegee it's good to go. The squeegee is very compact and slides into the bottom of the mirror's base, so it's never out of reach when you need it. The base beneath the mirror is perfect for holding my razor. If you have multiple people using this, the mirror tilts quite easily and holds in place even when filled with water. I have personally gotten into the habit of leaving it filled with the old water until my next shower, then dumping it and filling it with no problems. Though I have not needed to use them yet, the lights around the edges are the perfect brightness to not blind you while using them at close range. Overall, this is a great product and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to streamline their morning routine and simply shave in the shower. Keep up the great work guys
  127. The light stopped working on week 2 of having it. Other than that, it's a good shower mirror.
  128. The fog free works great! By pouring warm water in the reservoir behind the mirror, the mirror heats up and doesn't fog. The LEDs are another story. For me, in a relatively dark shower, the LEDs illuminate my face only when I get about 2 inches or less from the mirror. Any farther back, and they simply glare in my eyes, causing my pupils to contract, making my reflection appear darker! Also, the light is a very cold, harsh white. The only way a person would get a reflection as shown in the illustrating photo is to be in an already brightly lit room, thus negating the need for the LEDs.
  129. As advertised just not as bright as I thought it would be
  130. This is a really nice mirror. Shatter proof and well made. The two levels of lighting are really nice and can make a huge difference in a dimly lit shower area.<br /><br />It comes off the frame easily too and you can tilt it for people of different heights.
  131. As advertised does not fog up ,works really well best shaving mirror for the shower I have ever had I would highly recommend it to anybody
  132. This mirror is truly fogless, when directions are followed. The squeegee works fine and has easy storage.<br />Room for more than one razor on the shelf would be nice.<br />Overall, it works as advertised and I am very happy with this product.
  133. When I first attempted to install this mirror it didn't go so great. The silicon that was provided said to apply it and let it settle for 24 hours. After the first 24 hours passed, I put on the mirror and it ended up falling in my tub within minutes. After a quick trip to the hardware store for another tube of silicon, I let it cure for 48 hours (as recommended on the tube) and it is now on pretty much semi-permanently. The picture is sort of deceiving because the space between the mirror and the small shelf that holds your razor is actually closer together unless you angle the mirror in a high incline. The mirror is a proper size and I was actually thinking of getting the smaller size without the LEDs but I probably would've returned that one because I couldn't imagine using a smaller mirror than this one. Overall this is a pretty solid product.
  134. Really like this mirror. However I gave it 4 stars since the lights don't really illuminate all that well. The fact that it doesn't fog up is such a bonus. Would recommend.

I love the engineering as far as using hot water behind the mirror. I would like to see the larger size without lights. Or perhaps a seperate light that mounts high above shining down on your face not directly into your eyes. Overall good product. Price could be a little cheaper, doesn't look expensive to construct.

For those that like the idea of having a shower mirror for shaving I never owned one that has been as nice. I know it's only a shower mirror, but I was very pleased with the response from the company which is often rare to receive such a quick positive response and wanted others to be aware of their service.

  148. Improvements over earlier model:<br /><br />I also own the earlier version of this mirror without the LED lighting. Both versions work great, however; the lighting around my shower is very dim, so the LED lighting was a welcome addition. This version of the mirror is also larger than the previous version, but is installed on the same wall mount, so need to remove the old mount if you are upgrading.<br /><br />Great features applicable to both models:<br /><br />In addition to the fact that the mechanism used by this mirror truly makes it fogless, it has other great features as well. I have tiled walls in my shower, which means I can't use devices with suction cups. However, this mount relies on silicone adhesive, which works great. In addition, the squeegee that is included with this model seems to work better than the squeegee included with the prior model (which also worked reasonably well). Finally, the razor shelf is a nice touch to round out the functionality of this mirror.<br /><br />Minor suggested improvement:<br /><br />I think the only minor improvement I would suggest to the manufacturer is that it would be great if there was an option to magnify the glass by 10-20%.   157. Despite my initial fear...it's not as much of a pain loading it up with water as I thought it would be. The benefit of being able to spend longer in the hot shower since I can shave more diligently (no need to hurry to beat the fog) outweighs the 20 seconds it takes to load it up!<br /><br />RECOMMENDED!<br /><br />Update 2012-11-21: Had to update my review. ToiletTree's customer service is unbelievable! Among the top I've encountered. I called a few days ago due to experiencing the \\"drooping mirror\\" from the previous design and, without missing a beat, the nice gal I talked to (she sounded like she was in the states and calling from next door) said they've since redesigned that piece and would send out the updated part, free of charge.<br /><br />Fast forward to this morning (a few days later). Since my mirror is going to be useful again, I thought I'd change out the batteries since they were near death (LED lights were very dim). After my shower, I took the mirror over to my sink and, using a quarter, turned the two sealing screws to their respective \\"unlock\\" pictures. The top of the battery compartment opened just fine but the bottom, despite the sealing screw indicating it was unlocked, would not budge. I peaked inside of the top to see how the locking mechanism worked and was very confident all was in order and it was likely just a little stuck due to not having been opened for awhile. Sliding the screw along the seam between the door and battery compartment, I applied a little pressure to get it unstuck. To my surprise, the door finally popped open but when I turned the door over, I could see that the locking mechanism was still locked to the plastic piece it recessed into...and that piece had broken away from inside the battery compartment housing! :( Upon further investigation, I could see that the plastic piece that was supposed to turn to lock the door, was indeed stuck and the metal screw that attached it to the outside sealing screw just spun when the sealing screw turned -- I was never getting that door off. Even after tightening the metal screw, I couldn't get the two separated.<br /><br />So now, I had a part on the way to make my mirror useful again, but a broken battery door that rendered the LED system useless due to now being unsealable. How's that for irony? :) This morning, I was actually very confident that ToiletTree customer service would make things right, just from the painless interaction I had with them concerning the pivoting bracket a few days ago....and I wasn't disappointed. After explaining my situation to the gal on the phone (including the part that is on its way), she asked if replacing the battery compartment door would fix the issue. I indicated that, unfortunately, it would not, since the piece the bottom locking mechanism was supposed to lock to came detached from the inside battery compartment housing. I offered to send her a few pictures since (as you can see from above), it's not the easiest thing to convey over the phone. She said, \\"Oh no, no, that won't be necessary. What we'll do is send you out a new mirror. I'll expedite the shipment so you get it as soon as possible.\\"<br /><br />Now THAT's what I call customer service and a company that stands behind their product. I have no doubt in my mind that if the screw failure is not an isolated incident, that, just like with the pivot bracket, ToiletTree will make things right. Despite having the two issues I have, I have no reservations about recommending this product as well as the company.<br /><br />Update 2012-11-26: The replacement arrived. I opened the box and all had arrived as promised. *sigh* But I'm experiencing the exact same issue as before. Turning the bottom screw to unlock does indeed unlock that lock on the battery compartment door but turning the top screw (felt rather tight) to unlock does not unlock the bottom screw lock. Having been through this once and eventually getting the door off, I know that any pressure I use to successfully dislodge the door will result in another broken unit. *sigh* One more call to customer service tomorrow. Such a great idea. I haven't seen any other complaints when searching \\"screw\\" through the reviews and if it weren't such an easy action to take (i.e. turn screw to unlock symbol), I'd think there was something I was doing wrong. Will update after customer service call.<br /><br />Update 2012-11-27: Talked to Kelly at customer service. She indicated that the screw issue was not normal let alone getting another unit and having it occur right out of the box. To ToiltTree's credit, she's sending another unit out and test the door herself before sending. She is also sending prepaid postage to have me send the other two units back so they can take a look. Here's hoping that this is just a freak occurrence. With an idiot-proof design of \\"turn the arrow to the unlock symbol\\", I'm hoping that this is the case.<br /><br />I continue to be impressed with how ToiletTree customer service handles themselves, how the company backs their product, and how they value a customer's time and inconvenience. A++. I will update after new unit arrives.<br /><br />Update 2012-11-30: The new unit arrived. Little did I know, I'd open it to find a very nice, hand-written letter mentioning the postage-paid return sticker as well as a few sentences directing me to the fogless travel mirror they included to make up for the problems I've had so far. The unit seems like one I would expect to receive. The door screws are not overly tight (the issue I believe the other two suffered from but don't seem loose enough to cause seal issues.<br /><br />I will certainly update this review again if I have any issues but I don't really expect to. ToiletTree has a great product and they have an equally great customer service to back it up. I don't recall ever receiving this level of care from any other company...and there ARE a handful of good ones out there.<br /><br />The door was already taken off, as Kelly had indicated she would do as a matter of testing it. I placed the batteries in the compartment, screwed the door back on and put the mirror on the mount in the shower and am back to using the best fogless mirror around.<br /><br />Thank you Kelly and thank you for making it right ToiletTree! I would most certainly buy this product as a gift for any of my friends.<br /><br />TL;DR - ToiletTree's customer service is a class act, though the 2nd product still has an issue.y pressure I use to successfully dislodge the door will result in another broken unit. *sigh* One more call to customer service tomorrow. Such a great idea. I haven't seen any other complaints when searching \\"screw\\" through the reviews and if it weren't such an easy action to take (i.e. turn screw to unlock symbol), I'd think there was something I was doing wrong. Will update after customer service call.<br /><br />Update 2012-11-27: Talked to Kelly at customer service. To ToiltTree's credit, she's sending another unit out and test the door herself before sending. She is also sending prepaid postage to have me send the other two units back so they can take a look. Here's hoping that this is just a freak occurrence. With an idiot-proof design of \\"turn the arrow to the unlock symbol\\", I'm hoping that this is the case.<br /><br />I continue to be impressed with how ToiletTree customer service handles themselves, how the company backs their product, and how they value a customer's time and inconvenience.   158. Worked well, until the &#34;designed not to fall&#34; product fell. The &#34;shatter proof high quality acrylic&#34; mirror did not break as advertised! Just the surrounding plastic frame/reservoir shattered :( I still used for awhile after the unfortunate silicone adhesive failure, however the unit leaked like a sieve and would no longer hold the warm water to keep it fog-less.<br /><br />So on examining the adhesive left on the wall, I had plenty of surface area showing a good bond was made. All of the adhesive was on the tile side, none remained on the back of the mirror. I also had used the included double sided sticky pads, and the silicone was clear of the pads to make sure it was also directly mounted between tile and mirror. I really don't think I could have done a better job on the adhesive instructions.<br /><br />I would recommend slightly sanding or &#34;roughing up&#34; the back of the mirror prior to adhering it to the shower wall in order to give a little &#34;tooth&#34; for the silicone, something to give it something to stick to versus the smooth glossy finish.<br /><br />So to sum up, the mirror was really good for the 4 months I was able to use it, however, I have to rate lower since I feel that the included adhesive and/or design needs to be improved.

  174. This is the 3rd Fogless mirror that I have purchased from TTP going back to 2012. I decided to try the Deluxe LED after using the regular mirror and also the travel mirror.<br /><br />Point 1 - it is fogless... period end of story. Putting the hot water in the &#34;tank&#34; will keep the mirror fogless for as long as you want, its science not a gimmick and it won't wear off like the coated mirrors do.<br /><br />Point 2 - If you install it correctly it will stay on the wall. My original wall mount is still &#34;stuck&#34; on the wall almost 3 years after being installed. I put the new LED mirror in a different shower. Not rocket science either, put the whole tube of adhesive on the wall mount as shown, peel the sticker covers off put it on the wall and let it dry overnight. I cleaned the wall with a little rubbing alcohol on a pad just to make sure it was clean and more importantly dry.<br /><br />Point 3 - The LED Deluxe is a significantly larger mirror than the original, I have a round face shape so the regular mirror was a little small based on the landscape orientation. Not a problem with the Deluxe, it looks huge when shaving.<br /><br />Point 5 - The LED lights are nice, it helps alleviate some shadows but not blindingly bright, I also use this mirror to remove soft contacts on occasion and it really prevents shadows and allows me to see the lens (which is an issue since my vision is not being corrected at that point) after I slide it down off the pupil area. The battery compartment seems to be reasonably well sealed but a hot shower is a tough environment for electronics so we'll see how it holds up, I expect it will be fine. One nice thing is they don't use little tiny screws that will rust for the battery compartment cover more of a threaded friction lock type of fastener, I've seen similar fasteners/seals on boating equipment etc. that is designed for marine environments.<br /><br />Point 5 - I rarely use the squeegee just splash some water on the mirror face and it works for shaving, if doing delicate or really close work the squeegee will remove even tiny water droplets very quickly. Have not had any issues with water droplet stains or buildup on any of the mirrors to date.<br /><br />I wish it had more of a razor &#34;slot&#34; or hanger instead of just a shelf as I use a heavy DE razor and I won't leave it lying horizontally on the shelf but the mirror doesn't fog so I can hang my razor elsewhere. The shelf location under the mirror would probably make it difficult to get a razor out of a slot anyway.<br /><br />I've owned coated shower mirrors plain shower mirrors etc. they all usually end up fogging up after some time has passed but NOT these.<br /><br />Excellent product line and very responsive customer service when I tore the suction cups on the travel mirror.
  175. Mounted per the instructions but after 9 months came home to it shatterd on shower floor. Also, the mirror started to fade around corners.
  176. Very easy to install, even though I wasn't sure it would stick to the tile. Don't worry too much about being perfectly level on the bracket because the mirror can move slightly horizontally. I fill it up as soon as the water coming out is warm and it never fogs. Great job!
  177. Great mirror. ingenius method to ensure no steaming. that part works fine. the only issue i have had is the adjustable height. after a few uses, the adjustment stopped holding and i have to adjust my height to use it now. everything else is very well made.

I knocked it out of its mount and, full of water, it hit the tub, a five foot drop. Not even a scratch. I use the LED lights on high and after a month's use I'm still on the first (included) set of batteries. The only improvement I'd make, or like to see, is to have a model with a 5x magnifying mirror.   186. This was installed and operating for about 3 months. In the middle of one night, my family was woken by a loud bang. The entire mounting device and mirror had fallen from the shower wall {note there was no water in the mirror reservoir}. My kids take baths and I was frightened to think that this could of happened while they were in the tub; hitting their head. Note that I followed the installation instructions to a T and used the adhesive provided. And the mounting location is about 5 feet on an insert type shower/tub and on the opposite side of the shower head wall, so it receives very little water splash if any. Unless the manufacturer looks into providing better adhesive or alternate mounting, I would recommend screwing this to the shower wall or not using the product. Perhaps I received a defective product. So I will see if the manufacturer responds to this review. I will also contact amazon customer service to make them aware of this issue. I believe this product should last more than 11 months for the cost of $40.00. If the product description stated that I need to replace this product every 11 months, I would have never purchased it.   190. I've purchased several shower mirrors over the years and they have never worked well. Some relied on a chemical coating that was supposed to prevent fogging and it did for a month or so anyway. Others rely on batteries that wear out and must be replaced constantly.<br /><br />This one is perfect. It is the gold standard of shower mirrors. It works on basic science and hot water. No batteries, no chemicals. You just fill up the reservoir in the back of the mirror with the hot shower water, squeegee the front with the included squeegee, and you have a completely fogless mirror.<br /><br />I love it.<br /><br />Update: I have had this mirror for 5+ years. I have had to replace it twice because the back of the mirror breaks off where it connects to the wall unit. Both times it happened while one of my kids was showering. They make a travel version now that sells for $15 ([[ASIN:B008B9DU22 Fogless Shower Mirror with Squeegee by ToiletTree Products. Guaranteed to NEVER fog or your money back! Perfect for Home, Travel, and College Dorms!]]). I think I will try that one until my kids grow up and move out. :)

  193. This mirror works as advertised. You have be patient when you install the unit on your shower wall. You have to wait at least 24 hours for the caulk to cure on the frame to adhere properly to the shower wall. To ensure the mirror stays fogless all you have to do is to fill the small compartment behind the mirror with hot water. When you finish showering just empty the water from the mirror. I have previously purchased other types of fogless mirror that required a solution to be applied to the mirror.
  194. UPDATED 10/23/13: Yesterday I received the replacement pivot piece as promised. I popped it in, and was back in business! The updated pivot bracket is black in color vs. gray and appears to be made of slightly sturdier plastic. One thing I definitely noticed is that the mirror slid easily into and out of this bracket, unlike the one that broke, which required quite a bit of pressure. The pivot mechanism works much more smoothly now too. Even with water in the mirror, the whole arrangement feels far sturdier. I am positive this will last.<br /><br />I must admit that I was quite impressed that the company monitors reviews on its product. I was even more impressed that they offered to make it right. They even included a nice handwritten note and a free nail clipper/file with the replacement part. Companies that truly stand behind their products today are quite rare. ToiletTree is a small family-owned business, and given my experience I'll be more than happy to purchase their products again!<br /><br />UPDATED 10/12/13: The company president posted a comment to this review offering to send a replacement part. In his comment, he indicates the part that failed was strengthened recently. In the interim, I have updated my review from one to three stars as it does appear they stand behind their product and listen to customer feedback. Once I receive the replacement part and test it out some more, I'll update my review accordingly.<br /><br />My original review is below:<br /><br />My husband has been through tons of different shower mirrors over the years. Most that promise to be fog-free, are not. This one actually is fog-free, however. He liked that aspect, as well as the lights, mirror size, and the fact that it was adjustable. He disliked having to remove and fill the tank, saying it was awkward to get on and off the wall bracket. He also felt that the brackets on the tilt mechanism were flimsy and worried that they would break. Unfortunately, his fears proved correct, as one of the plastic \\"wings\\" on the tilt mechanism became wobbly then broke after just two months of use. He did attempt a repair, but the mirror was no longer stable enough to remove to put water into the reservoir. Even the slightest bump causes the mirror plus tilt mechanism to pop off entirely. In short, the mirror isn't very useful right now.<br /><br />As he's been grumbling about it for the past few weeks, I came to Amazon tonight entertaining the idea of getting him a replacement, not realizing we'd only had it such a short time! Furthermore, in looking at the tilt mechanism myself right now, I can see why he was so concerned. It truly is a flimsy design. Both of the wings on ours were cracked in more than one place, so it is no wonder why it became so unstable. The wings on the tilt mechanism attach at only two places on either side, making it really easy for those fail. Too bad a cheap plastic part ruined what promised to be a nice product.<br /><br />Obviously, I'm not about to spend another $50 and risk getting burnt again. He'll have to do with a simple mirror on a hook this time. My advice is to save your money unless the company does a BIG redesign to strengthen that part.as one of the plastic \\"wings\\" on the tilt mechanism became wobbly then broke after just two months of use. But I loved the mirror because it was the only one I used that did not fog up and I tried them all. I remember thinking many times that the only thing missing from this mirror was a light.<br /><br />So when I reordered and received a replacement non-lighted shower mirror, I was thrilled to see on the box advertising that ToiletTree had a lighted shower mirror available. I returned the non-lighted shower mirror and ordered the lighted shower mirror. I'm in heaven. Not only is there light, but the light is framed around the mirror providing BALANCED lighting (unlike the light above the medicine cabinet mirror over a bathroom sink that shines down on your head making it so you need to hold a flashlight under your neck in order to see to shape the bottom of your beard or goatee).<br /><br />Another big plus was that I did not need to remove the holder for the non-lighted shower mirror to hang the lighted shower mirror, the lighted shower mirror just slid down over the non-lighted shower mirror holder so I was up and running in less than a minute. This mirror is worth every cent it costs. If you have a goatee, beard, chin strap, or any kind of facial hair that needs to be shaped or outlined regularly, this is the mirror you want in your shower.

  206. This handy little mirror works as advertised and with a quick swipe of the squeegee delivers fogless shaving. It’s not a hindrance at all to fill with warm water especially if there’s an immediate payoff of shave-clarity.<br /><br />I really, REALLY want to love this mirror but there are two basic things holding me back. The first is the actual mirror… It’s understandably not made of glass so distorts a bit at any distance over 12 inches. I can get past this as it’s not a huge inconvenience to get up close and personal in the shower. It would be nice if ToiletTree minimized the distortion as the product evolves… The second is a bit harder to get over and involves, well, me. I constantly forget to dump out the warm water. Not a big deal except a few days ago the mirror fell off of my shower wall after being secure for 3+ months. I’m assuming it was because the weight of the mirror filled with water was too much for the silicon. It definitely could have been my “non-pro” installation but I would think it would have fallen after a few days or weeks not 3 months.<br /><br />The unit didn't break so I’m going to find more silicon and see if I can get it back on the wall. I’m considering drilling small drain holes to allow the water to escape if I forget to dump it. It might be a nice product improvement to include a punch out or some other mechanism to create holes for those of us who want the mirror to drain.

As the reviews promised, it works very well. It is foggy when you first get in the shower, but after you fill it with water and use the attached squeegee, you are ready to go (the whole process takes less than 30 seconds). It is attractive and clean-looking.<br /><br />I know some other mirrors require you to spray with certain chemicals or have finishes that can wear off, but I think this one is purely a hot water trick so there is no need for extra chemicals. You are actually NOT supposed to use glass cleaner on it ever, just a sponge and squeegee. Easy maintenance.<br /><br />Finally, I liked this mirror because our shower isn't very well lit, and since it is used as a shaving mirror it makes sense to actually be able to see your face. The LED lights are not so bright that they'd correct for a totally dark shower, but we just needed a little boost of light and this is absolutely perfect.<br /><br />I've had no problems with attaching it either.<br /><br />Bottom line is, this isn't the cheapest mirror out there - but I am pretty confident that we won't have to replace it any time soon, and reading the reviews on the cheaper mirrors made me think they were just temporary. You get what you pay for - buy well, and take care of it, and you can't go wrong.

The fact that the mirror will not stay at the proper angle overrides all of the good things about this mirror rendering it relatively useless to me.

  242. These mirrors are absolutely without question THE best shower mirror I've ever owned (this is probably my 3rd or 4th Toiletree fogless shower mirror- no fault of theirs). I bought this one as a replacement for one at a house I just sold and wanted a new one for my new shower... These mirrors never fog and remain clear for many years. Couple of tips: Follow the directions when installing -wait 24 hours before you use it so the silicone adhesive will set properly; empty the water reservoir after each use - I didn't on my lake house shower mirror and the hard water caused the mirror backing to disintegrate over time (my fault - not theirs). You'll LOVE this mirror!
  243. Ordered this product in February 2013. The mirror performed as advertised: it never fogs when filled with warm shower water, which is very easy to do! The only tricky part was mounting its holding bracket on the wall so that the mirror looks horizontally straight when shaving. Best strategy is to have the mirror on the bracket at the time it is positioned on the wall. Once straight, remove the mirror, leaving the bracket's tape to cure overnight.<br />After 9 months, however, the bottom surface of my mirror started to show substantial deterioration. Dull spots appeared looking like water stains, but they were not. Could not be removed by scrubbing with alcohol, vinegar, or Lime-A-way. They originated behind the mirror surface, looking like degradation of the &#34;silver coating&#34;.<br />I called the seller, Toilet Tree Product, and was immediately sent a new replacement mirror, which is working fine. It looks like the company stands by its product with no hassle.
  244.   253. I should have listened to the reviews, especially the older ones. I did not install the unit until a couple of months ago and do not use it more than twice a week, as I am retired and do not shave every day. I installed it exactly as instructed, even cleaning the wall VERY well before using the glue and sticking it to the wall. In all fairness, it worked very well. Filling it with hot water, very hot, provides an almost perfectly clear (no fog) mirror. Sadly, and as predicted by some comments, the whole thing crashed into the floor and broke this weekend. The shower was not on and nobody was in the room with it. The &#34;glues&#34; just let go. Of course, due to my usual procrastination and late installation, I am a few weeks past the return period. Do not let that happen to you. If you do want to chance buying it, install it day one and use it often to see if it will stick. Mine did not.
  254. This is the best unit that I could find after I bought and returned at least ten others. In order to upgrade from here, a substantial price increase comes with it. This unit has an led light that surrounds the rectangle and is switchable. Other units have round lights and 5 minute timers. This unit comes with no suction cups. It is for serious users only. The reservoir in back is filled with hot water and under the laws of physics the mirror stays clear. Magnification options would be an interesting upgrade. Short of that, this unit gets the job done. Show me something under $100 that works better and I will add the last star to my review.

  267. I'm not one for product reviews, really. I read them voraciously, but rarely do I bother to write them.<br /><br />I've been thrilled with this mirror. I purchased it in December 2014 after reading a glowing review on www.thesweethome.com (and a gazillion of them on Amazon). Amazon delivered quickly, the instructions were straightforward and readable, and I installed it right away. After waiting the recommended 24-hours after install, I took my first shower/shave with this puppy, and it was delightful. It stayed completely fog free, the LEDs did a commendable job of lighting my bearded mug, it held my shaving gear just so, and when a little droplet of water found its way to the reflective surface, I quickly and delightedly wiped that sucker away with the included squeegee. I've used it with joy ever since.<br /><br />Then, the horror. In my deepest slumber, I heard a horrific racket from the bathroom. Of course I assumed it was an intruder. I grabbed the phone book I keep under my bed for just such intrusions (just kidding), and wandered into the bathroom to identify the source of the commotion. My beloved mirror had fallen from the tile wall and rest sad and broken on the shower floor.<br /><br />I wept (but just a little), and went back to bed.<br /><br />Not long after, I shot an email to the company in the hopes they would have some advice for me. Without so much as a question, they immediately offered to send me a new one free of charge and included a silicone remover to get the old goop from the wall.<br /><br />This review, I guess, is to sing the praises of the mirror first and foremost. But it also aims to sing the praises of the company, which handled my issue quickly, fairly, without question, and with the utmost respect. I have been thrilled from tip to tail.<br /><br />Just buy the mirror already. It'll change your life in small but meaningful ways. And if it doesn't, rest assured the company will remedy that for you.

  276. I bought this fogless shower mirror in August, 2012. It worked very well as a fogless mirror in the shower for shaving. It works by filling the narrow tank behind the mirror. I just held it up to the shower head for a few seconds. The perimeter LED lights have 2 brightness levels and provide plenty of light for shaving. The batteries last for a reasonable time unless you forget to turn it off which I did a few times. The mirror rotates up & down to get the right view angle. But this is where the product first started to fail. The up/down angle adjustment has set positions that &#34;click&#34; into place and after a while it doesn't hold the position, the mirror just flops all the way down. There is no adjustment to tighten the detents. Next to fail was the LED lights. Its probably not really the lights themselves but internal wiring or some sort of corrosion. The last time the lights didn't work, I thought I had left it on. New batteries did not help, neither did cleaning the battery box. It's a lot of money to spend for about 10 months of service. Its a good principle for providing a fogless mirror (backing the mirror with hot water), but everything else failed. I'm sorry I wasted my money and I can't recommend it.
  277. My husband loves it! Very Easy to install
  278. So I have had a private war with &#34;fogless&#34; mirrors over the last 15 years and finally I've found one that actually does what it's supposed to do. I can't recommend this thing enough. No, it's not worth removing a star over. I ended up planing a piece of wood to fit behind the tilt mechanism and it's good as new. Also, so far, it's still sticking on the wall! Again, much better than the other pieces of junk I've monkeyed around with over the years.
  279. I received this mirror nine months ago. It was doing great for about eight months. Then some spotting started to show up on the mirror. However, I recently purchased this product again for myself and surprised to find no modifications were made to prevent water from truly leaking into the battery compartment. Therefore, I've taken the extra step to use silicone caulking to seal the lid to the mirror preventing water from finding its way into the area. I wished the company would provide a more secure way to seal it without &#34;hacking&#34; it but I DO enjoy the product and find it meets my needs to shave in the shower. Unless I use a cup to fill the mirror with warm water, I take the mirror off the wall holder and place it under the shower head to fill it prior to use. I realize I will have to remove the silicone caulking when the batteries die out but until then, I'll keep my fingers crossed. A lithium battery with a tighter waterproof seal would be a welcomed change to the design of this product.

  313. I had a little apprehension about purchasing the product due to its price point. However, now that I have it installed in my shower, it's the best money spent. Installation was a breeze. Allow silicone (removable) to set up overnight and you'll be all set for the following day. Ingenious feature on the mirror in which you fill up the back with hot water, thus making the mirror the same temp as shower water, which results in no fogging!! The accompanying squeegee fits nice in its slot and works excellent. Highly recommend.

That's what he said metters. He added just about everything man makes can break. Those who make it right the quickest are the ones you want to deal with. ToiletTree Products made it right, right away without any questions. That's hard to come by...even when I didn't think it was their fault.

  325. I had a hard time getting my husband to shave every day. He loves being able to shave in the shower. It doesnt fog up and gives off a lot of light.
  326. THE PRODUCT:<br />The mirror is great! I've had several 'fogless' mirrors but none have ever stayed fogless. I usually have to splash water on the mirror until it warms up enough that it doesn't fog. It will clear up the fog but then you are left with large water droplets on the mirror. The last mirror I had with an LED was the [[ASIN:B00A3Q7EMI Zadro ZFogless Fog Free Lighted Shower]] This one was OK but the clock on it was slow and needed adjusted every few months and it fogged up quickly.<br /><br />The ToiletTree mirror is an excellent concept. It's easy to pull the mirror off the stand and fill with water. It's also easy to reattach the mirror as the clip is large and fits nicely into the stand. The integrated squeegee and small shelf for my razor are perfect. Have had zero issues with it coming loose on the wall. I used the epoxy and self-adhesive pads that were pre-installed.<br /><br />The only issue I had with this product was a broken clip on the battery door. The 'unlock' screw did not unlock when turned to that setting. I pried up on the door but it broke. Using the number provided in the packaging, I called and the President of the company answered immediately - no answering system. They quickly offered to send a replacement. I am still waiting on it to arrive and will edit my review to include the functionality of the LED light - which I have not been able to use yet.

  346. I bought two of these mirrors, one for my husband and the other for my son this Christmas. I had read the great reviews for this mirror and decided to take a chance since both my husband and son prefer to shave in the shower. My biggest concern was how much of a problem it may be to fill the container on the mirror w/water every time you shower. To my delight it is no hassle at all! You simply lift off the reservoir from the wall attachment and fill while showering and place it back on the wall attachment to shave and there is no fogging at all! Both my husband and son love this mirror! It was easy to attach to the wall, took about 20 minutes to read instructions, decide where we wanted to place it and attach it. And looks like it would also be easy to remove from the wall if necessary. I rarely would write a glowing review about a product, but this is really a great mirror. It stands true to the claim \\"fogless\\", is easy to attach and easy to use. It also comes w/a squeegee and a light. I don't really think the light is necessary unless you shower in the dark! All in all we are very satisfied w/our fogless mirrors.

  349. This mirror is great, I was a little uneasy mounting it with the sticky tape/silicon that came with the kit, so I used 3 velco 3M command strips instead. My shower is cultured marble/plastic, and I know how hard it is to scrape clear silicon off. You have to fill the mirror with water every time for it to work, and then use the little squeegee to wipe the water that gets on it, but it works well after you do. The built in light is ok, I don't really use it. It would be nice if it had an auto-shutoff feature like some of the other mirrors I have tried. There is no magnification, which I like. Some of the magnified mirrors gave me headaches. So if you are looking for a simple, large mirror with no gimmicks that doesn't have mounting hassles this is the one for you...<br /><br />Pros...<br />Large Size<br />Fogless feature works<br />No magnification/distorted image<br />Lighted<br />No suction cups to deal with<br /><br />Cons...<br />Permanent Mounting (Used command strips instead)<br />Hinge is a little wobbly, mirror doesn't sit level<br /><br />EDIT: a few months after using this and the hinge can no longer support it, I stuck a sponge behind it to hold it up, but the hinge is a bad design.   383. [[ASIN:B005OSQGN8 Deluxe LED Fogless Shower Mirror with Squeegee by ToiletTree Products. Guaranteed Not to Fog, Designed Not to Fall. 20% Larger Than Our #1 Selling Original Mirror.]]<br /><br />I replaced my Sharper Image metal fog-free shower mirror with this product. After nearly destroying the Sharper Image product during it's removal from our prior address I was looking for something that did not require a plumbing connection. Overall the product works as advertised; I was annoyed by packaging, the included adhesive quality, and the quality of some of the materials which I will detail later. First the positive aspects:<br /><br />1) The product does indeed work as a fog-free mirror so I can shave in the shower<br />2) Installation was relatively easy and required about 15 minutes to position and install<br />3) We have an enormous shower, so the up-lighting from the LED lights is a positive (works great - two brightness settings is unnecessary for me)<br />4) Integrated squeegee is a nice touch (lacks a handle for those of us who no longer have child size hands)<br /><br />The reasons I did not score this product with 5-stars:<br /><br />A) The silicone adhesive sent with the product was dry and hard when I received - I had some silicone caulk which I used. It would have been a hardship for me to return the order to Amazon or go buy additional silicon adhesive at the hardware store. How annoying! I suspect this company used a very low cost Chinese manufacturer and provider of the silicone that comes bundled with the product. Also, they appear to lack a quality management program that would have weeded out this annoyance prior to delivery to Amazon or the end-customer (me).<br /><br />B) The materials used in the manufacture of the product appear to be really inexpensive. I've not dropped the mirror, but the fact that it hangs on a \\"latch\\" mechanism and is used in a wet environment with hard flooring increases the risk that it will break on impact. Perhaps they could have coated the cheap plastic with rubber to make it more impact resistant and less \\"cheap feeling.\\" Another alternative would be chrome or stainless metal.<br /><br />C) I'm annoyed that I have to pull it off the wall to fill with water for a fog free experience. This is not an impossible task, but as I mentioned in (B), I really dislike the latch.<br /><br />D) The orientation should be portrait, but the product can only be installed in \\"landscape\\"...my face will hopefully remain longer than it is wide for many years.<br /><br />E) The squeegee needs a larger handle, it works OK, but I have to pinch it like it's a sewing needle. This shows a real lack of consideration for who is using the product...it's not a 4-year old or a lobster using the product, it's a grown man! Please size the squeegee for a grown man's hands!<br /><br />F) This product needs a razor handle holder and a shaving cream holder. The shelf is OK for the razor handle, but my razor feels precarious laying on the ledge and I would prefer a holder that is simply a loop or hole to place the razor handle into. The shelf will not hold a can of shaving cream, unless it's sized for a doll. If you are going to produce a large plastic product to hang on the wall at least design it so it has more utility for all the aspects of a grown man's shaving experience!<br /><br />November 2013: Yes, it truly does lack quality in the tilt mechanism. 17 months into ownership and the tilt has failed - the mirror hangs in a depressive \\"down\\" position and no amount of tender coaxing will bring it up to where my face is for the shave. ToiletTree has made some nice progress promoting their products on other online sites. Perhaps it's possible they have updated the product in the 17 months since I purchased with the bad batch of silicon.could have coated the cheap plastic with rubber to make it more impact resistant and less \\"cheap feeling.\\" Another alternative would be chrome or stainless metal.<br /><br />C) I'm annoyed that I have to pull it off the wall to fill with water for a fog free experience. This is not an impossible task, but as I mentioned in (B), I really dislike the latch.<br /><br />D) The orientation should be portrait, but the product can only be installed in \\"landscape\\"...my face will hopefully remain longer than it is wide for many years.<br /><br />E) The squeegee needs a larger handle, it works OK, but I have to pinch it like it's a sewing needle. This shows a real lack of consideration for who is using the product...it's not a 4-year old or a lobster using the product, it's a grown man! Please size the squeegee for a grown man's hands!<br /><br />F) This product needs a razor handle holder and a shaving cream holder. The shelf is OK for the razor handle, but my razor feels precarious laying on the ledge and I would prefer a holder that is simply a loop or hole to place the razor handle into. The shelf will not hold a can of shaving cream, unless it's sized for a doll. If you are going to produce a large plastic product to hang on the wall at least design it so it has more utility for all the aspects of a grown man's shaving experience!<br /><br />November 2013: Yes, it truly does lack quality in the tilt mechanism. 17 months into ownership and the tilt has failed - the mirror hangs in a depressive \\"down\\" position and no amount of tender coaxing will bring it up to where my face is for the shave. I like this product as it is a time saver for me in that shaving is not a process for after the shower but during - and I think it better for your skin to shave after or better yet during your shower.<br /><br />The one complaint I would have to register is that when the mirror is filled with water it is difficult to angle the mirror as the weight from the water causes it to flop down. So instead of having the perfect angle on the mirror, you have to find an angle that the mirror will accommodate with the weight of water, which does in fact, perfectly prevents the mirror from fogging. So I would recommend mounting the mirror so upper or lower angle adjustments are not needed. Other than the previous mentioned flaw, this is a nice product that I would recommend.

  390. First and foremost, the mirror works as advertised. It's a great product, and I would highly recommend it. That said, I have had a couple of issues with it.
