When I moved, I called them, and they shipped me another mounting kit at no charge. After about a year of use, the articulating bracket got stripped and the mirror would stay at the lowest position. Again, I called them and they shipped me a new and improved bracket -- again at no charge. So, although there have been a few inconveniences with the product, its quality and their excellent customer service result in me being a raving fan. Great job Toilet Tree.
  391. EDIT 11/04/2012 - Within 24 hours I received an email from the President of ToiletTree Products and he wished to make sure he could fix any issues I was having with the product. This type of commitment to a product is rare in today's market. I would not hesitate to recommend this product or to buy future products from this company. Thank you ToiletTree Products for listening to your customers and standing by your product.<br /><br />Original Post 11/03/2012 -I bought this product in January 2012. This worked as advertised out of the box. A few months later the tilt mechanism stopped working properly. When I put water in the mirror the mirror would tilt all the way down. No big issue I put small travel shampoo in between the wall and the mirror and the angle was fine. However, on November 1, 2012 at 3:00 am the mirror,which is designed not to fall, fell. This scared and woke the family up.<br /><br />The product light worked fine, the fogless design worked great. The angle device and the \\"designed not to fall\\" failed.<br /><br />I am not sure how to return this or if it will be replaced. I looked to contact the seller to see what they advised but could not find any contact information. Amazon has a return but it will cost me in shipping.<br /><br />So my opinion of the product is that it was great the first couple of months and then it began to fail.   393. This product works GREAT!!! This is not my first shower mirror. The first one I bought would fog up constantly and was simply a hassle as a result. Not this one. Simply fill it with hot water and you have a fog free mirror for the entire length of your shower or bath. Simple to install, it comes with a small tube of silicone which is plenty to hold the mount securely to the wall. The mirror tilts to adjust to the different heights of your family members, and yes they will use it even if they are not shaving, especially if you have teenage daughters. However this tilt, while convenient, became problematic when the mechanism began to lose its grip and the mirror would flop down. I called Amazon and, great as the Customer Service Dept always is, they were willing to deduct the cost of a new mount or refund the purchase cost. I really didn't want to return it because I love the product. Amazon provided me with the number for the manufacturer and told me to find out how much the cost would be for a new mount. There was no need to get back to Amazon. I called the company and they were aware of the problem. They have designed a new mechanism and they are sending me one at no cost. The rep told me that I could expect it in 1 or 2 days. Awesome. I would imagine that any new order will come with the new mount so you won't run into this problem. If you shave in the shower, or just like looking at yourself and don't we all, then you should buy this mirror.

After ten years of falling, the plastic holding the suction cups broke off for the past several years I was just propping it or just holding it while I shave. Also, it would fog up, though it was supposed to be fogless. I came across this one that you fill with hot water to keep it from fogging. The enclosed silicone did not work well. It may have been that it didn't really come with enough silicone. So I bought some RTV silicone from Home Depot and stuck it to the travertine tile in the shower. It stays in place! It's nice to have this in the shower to shave with. A little pricey, but if this can last me 20 years or so, I'll be happy. Even though I had to use my own silicone, I still give it five stars.

  435. I held off doing this review until I had the mirror for a couple of months. I cant say enough good things about it. The sheer size of it sets it apart from the other shower mirrors and the LED turns great into &#34;awesome&#34;. I have had four other shower mirrors including those a radio in them. None of them hold a candle to this one (and the radio mirror lasted exactly 23 hours until it fell off the wall and broke the radio). The other mirrors were much smaller so you had to get close to them to use them.<br /><br />Most shower mirrors use suction cups and the mirrors I have owned had a nasty habit of falling off the wall... usually at 3:00 a.m. This mirror uses silicone glue to mount it to the wall. Yes - it takes a few more steps and a bit of planning to mount it but it is worth it. We remodeled our shower using &#34;bumpy&#34; tiles so suction cups no longer worked. I had to find a mirror that mounted in a different way. Before you worry about gluing it to your tile, I had to move it and after I peeled it from the wall, I was able to quickly clean up the silicone by simply rubbing it off and using a bit of Goo-Gone. So it is a &#34;permanent&#34; mounting that you can remove, clean up and reposition. I dont know if this works on slate so if you have a slate shower you may want to check with the manufacturer.<br /><br />Using it is simple - you fill it with warm water when you are in the shower (the mirror comes off the mounting bracket very easily), place it back on the bracket, use the included squeegee that stores in the base (that is pretty slick!) to clean the drops off the mirror, and shave. It never fogs (due to the water inside) and tilts up and down a few degrees to move it into the optimal position for shaving.<br /><br />So - the Pros - Size, LED light, squeegee to clean the drops off the mirror, mounting bracket, tilting bracket.<br /><br />The only &#34;cons&#34; I can think of after using it for a couple of months are that the LED lights dont turnoff automatically - but this really isnt an issue since LED doesnt drain a battery like a normal light, and there is no &#34;auto-drain&#34; feature. Most mirrors that you fill with water slowly let it drip out to empty it. This mirror doesnt have that - but having the water drain like that can cause a calcium stain so dumping the water after use doesnt bother me. Neither of these &#34;cons&#34; detract from the awesomeness of this shower mirror!<br /><br />This is one of the most expensive shower mirrors out there but it is well worth the money and is (based on what I have seen) the largest out there. Spend the extra money and get this mirror. You wont regret it.

  446. I have shaved in the shower for almost 40 years and it has become my morning ritual. We have well water here and the hardness/softness can fluctuate due to my lack of proper tracking.<br /><br />As such I have had the need to replace my shower shaving mirror every second or third year. The mirror surface would become dull and pitted, water spotted and scratched due to the constant cleaning in attempts to bring the mirrors back to their original condition.<br /><br />I purchased the ToiletTree Deluxe LED Fogless Shower Mirror due, primarily, to it's high rating here on Amazon. After 45 days of use I could not be happier with that decision.<br /><br />The installation was done with ease by simply following the well thought out instructions and using the adhesive supplied. I gave the mounting bracket a full 24 hours to set-up, as instructed, before actually using the mirror and have had no issues.<br /><br />The added size is welcome, she square shape is, hands down, a cut above the round mirrors I had been using in the past. The daily fill with hot water is painless and quick, the emptying procedure is self explanatory. The supplied squeegee is adequate.<br /><br />The LED light is more than adequate. The only improvement I could possible like to see is the light being timer activated; more than once I have had to reach back into the shower to turn off the light after exiting. No biggie.<br /><br />Am I pleased? Very much so. Would I purchase another? In a heart beat.

  451. After muddling through a number of awful shower mirrors over the last few years, I've finally found one that checks all the boxes, and truly does everything right.<br /><br />1. It attaches to the tile shower very well, and feels rock-solid once the silicone adhesive has set.<br />2. It is BIG! Larger than any of the others I've seen on the market. This, coupled with the ability to tilt it, means that it works for me (6'3\\") to shave, and for my wife (5'9\\") to remove makeup.<br />3. It lights up brightly. While a lot of shower mirrors have a light on them, I haven't seen any as bright as this one, which is great for shaving.<br />4. It has a holder for my razor. I had a mirror before with a type of \\"hook\\" to hold my Fusion razor, but it was flimsy and would drop often. The shelf on this one is perfect.<br />5. IT ACTUALLY WORKS!!! While I've had shower mirrors in the past that worked well for a couple weeks before the anti-fog coating wore off, this one seems like it will last for the long-haul. The reason is the way it works: The mirror slides easily off of its bracket, and you fill the back with hot water to match the temperature of the shower. After that, you can use the included squeegee to wipe off the water drops. The whole process takes about 5 seconds, and the mirror stays perfectly fog-free for the duration of the shower.<br /><br />In short, I'm a big fan!

  461. Great mirror for shaving in the shower. It absolutely does not fog when used correctly. One minor annoyance is forgetting to pour off the warm water when done shaving...and dousing yourself with cold water the next morning. My real complaint is that the mirror crashed down in the middle of the night after about two years, scaring me out of a deep sleep. The silicone glue is still permanently on the shower wall; the mirror simply came unstuck from it. So, sadly, I'm back to shaving at the sink before my shower. I also want to stress that my installation was meticulously perfect (I'm a little neurotic about following instructions). To prove that point, I have a much larger and heavier wall-mounted dispenser made by Simple Human that has supported the weight of body wash, shampoo, and conditioner for about five years.
  462. Mirror image is not crisp, more reminiscent of old metal mirror images of camping days rather than glass mirror. If you can order a higher quality mirror on a movable mechanism, you'd be better off
  463. This Item works - it's great being able to shave in the shower with a mirror that doesn't fog up. The light is a nice touch too.
  464. We love the Deluxe LED Fogless Shower Mirror! My hubby uses it to shave, my 6 year old son uses it to pretend to shave and I use it to make sure I washed off all of my facewash before leaving the shower! Many uses, great product, highly reccomend!
  465. After a decade or more of mirror after mirror that claims to be fogless, all being a miserable failure, the ToiletTree guys finally nailed it. It's been firmly mounted in my shower since Christmas morning and not going anywhere! My previous OXO one would fall down seconds after putting it up. It was a constant battle with that mirror during shaving. Now, with the ToiletTree mirror I don't fear for multiple broken toes every morning.
  466. The top reviewer for this product says it all and then some. One suggestion I have would be that when you are picking a place to mount this in your shower take into consideration water splashing on the mirror. I wish I had mounted mine a little farther from the shower spout. I don't think the LED light is very effective; maybe this is because the ambient light in my show drowns it out, but this light is at my back and I could benefit from more light.<br /><br />Update: After one year the mirror has clouded up. This is not on the surface of the mirror and it is bad enough to really impair its usefulness, so I am downgrading from 5 stars to 3 stars.
  467. Started shaving in the shower nearly 20 years ago and it is MUCH easier with a mirror, especially since I also shave my head for the past 2 years. Having used different mirrors I was happy to find one that has really cured the fog issue. Size and design are nice, good little squeegee and ledge, light leaves room for desire: does not shine on the face enough without leaning in on it.<br />Quality is a 5, just needs better lighting.<br />Word to the wise: on the off chance that you do not shave every day or you are going to be out of town for a stretch, I suggest that you empty the reservoir after every shave.
  468. It works exactly as advertised. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is the silicon adhesive was (apparantly) so old that it had hardend at the bottom of the tube and I could not get all of it out. I tried everything up to a rolling pin, but to no avail. The instructions tell you to use the whole tube so I had to go to Lowes and get the same stuff to make up for the difference. No biggie, but in the future, either send a bigger tube or or don't sent silicon that was produced before Nixon resigned.
  469. I purchased this mirror to hang in my shower. I followed the directions, but after the second day the mirror came loose from the tiles. I then held the mirror with one hand and shaved with the other hand, all the time with the shower getting the mirror steaming up. I think it is a good idea, but you might want to find a better way to secure it to the shower wall.
  470. After going through several different mirrors. This one is finally the one. The ability to fill it with warm water keep the mirror fog free. Also, the ability to silicone it to the wall is perfect. No more stupid suction cups and hurt toes by it falling off.

  473. I have used this mirror in my shower for over a year now and it works great. It holds to the wall with the adhesive that comes with the package and does not fog up.

  476. Product works well enough. The enclosed silicone adhesive discolored white cultured marble with yellowing. The manufacturer really needs to incorporate heavy duty suction cups in 3 to 4 places and redesign the battery door to make this item a winner.
  477. Bought this for the hubby who thought it would be nice to shave in the shower. He had no problem mounting it to the tile wall and enjoys being able to shave in the shower.   478. On the Plus side, the adhesive and fogless aspects work very well. The customer telephone support was also timely and apparently American based. The LED lighting is not as good as my last one, which was purchased several years ago and unfortunately left in a hotel; some illegal alien is probably enjoying it now.<br /><br />The three AA batteries will last a reasonable length of time (weeks) so long as you remember to empty the water bin promptly after each use. My experience over several months is that the batteries will be drained if you forget to empty the water tank even if you remember to turn off the light between uses; the battery compartment appears dry even when the tank is left filled. I recommend that the unit be modified to include a light timer (auto off after a few minutes) and a reminder to empty the water tank. A lesser number of higher intensity LEDs would probably do a better job of lighting your face.
  479. This would have been a GREAT product if the lighting would have lasted more than 2 months, which began to flicker then failed completely.   480. Cheaply made of the worlds worst quality plastic. It looks and functions more like a $5 product than the almost $50 I was charged. Even the glass is plastic. It also does not work at all, fogs up all the time despite the anti fog features.<br />DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS!
  481. This is an awesome product It never fogs up and I can see my whole head in the mirror. it works perfect No complaints
  482. We have had several shower mirrors over the years, and this by far is one of the best ones. It is sturdy, works well and easy to put up. I did not use the adhesive strips that came with the product though. I went to the hardware store and purchased strips of plastic velcro with adhesive on the back. It holds more weight and to me, secured the product better than what it was packaged with. What came with the product could very well work, but I have had several mirrors fall due to poor adhesive, so just did not want to take the chance. The squeegie is handy as is the light (two levels of brightness) and the mirror does not fog. I really like the light - I seldom turn on my bathroom light when showering - the light on the mirror is sufficient. Note: Mirror must be filled with warm water when you shower, in order for the mirror to not fog. It is not a big deal - fill at the beginning of your shower and empty when you're done.
  483. When I stumbled across this mirror on amazon, I questioned the value of the item at the price offered. Having been discouraged by the dozen or so mirrors I had previously purchased that either spotted, fogged despite claims to the otherwise, and/or didn't age well, I thought what the heck.... one more isn't going to break me. To my surprise, it's the best mirror I have ever used to shave in the shower; always clear, well light (2 settings powered by battery) and well sealed with the glue that comes with it, its value exceeds its price. I think I may have found the last mirror I'll search for in fogless shower mirrors.<br /><br />Update 3/21/15. I'm still using this unit and it's still working like clockwork. I noticed the batteries were not lasting as long so I called the company. Three days later I had a new unit at my door. Outstanding customer service!!

  495. I agree with all the positive reviews for this product, but I wanted to chime in regarding the LED light. I went with the LED light, and I'm glad that I did. While my shower has enough light to use the product without the light turned on, using the light makes shaving even easier. The added brightness helps quite a bit. If you can affod the extra $20, and don't have a light directly in your shower, I think you should go for the light.
  496. Due to the heavy weight of this mirror when the reservoir is filled with water, the mirror must be attached to the wall with glue (which is included in the box). Suction cups alone are not strong enough to hold the mirror. This was not a problem for me, but some people may not prefer this kind of &#34;permanent&#34; installation. The mirror works as described, when the reservoir if filled with hot water, the mirror does not fog. The lights are helpful, but not as bright as I was hoping they would be. I really like the mirror, I was unable to give it five stars based on value as it was expensive (~$50).
  497. 100% fog free. Mount seems good and solid. I now shave my head & face in the shower. I expect this to last a long time.

  500. Works great, ingenious. Disappointed in the light though. It does what it claimed, \\"illuminates the entire mirror surface\\" but unless you are within 1 or 2 inches of it, it won't illuminate your face at all.<br /><br />OK, it's been months since I purchased this and have used it daily since. It is very functional except for the light which as previously noted I don't use at all. With a secondary light source it works extremely well.<br /> I typically get almost a steam shower going and once this mirror is filled with warm water and squeegeed off I have a perfectly clear shaving mirror in a nice steamy shower, which is optimum for shaving.<br /> One thing I don't know if intended in the design, is that the mirror itself distorts a little after a few uses with hot water so that at close up it magnifies similar to a concave shaving mirror. At first I did not like this aspect but now,after frankly , it makes it better especially as my old eyes are not as sharp as they were. Buy this mirror, or better still save 20 bucks and buy it's non lit version.

  504. I am a big online shopper and I always leave a comment (recommendation) either good or bad for the products that I have purchased. When I read the information on the Fogless Mirror from ToiletTree Products I thought that I had finally found the ultimate fogless mirror for my shower. I bought the lighted mirror because I often shower early and need the light when I shave. Well, when the mirror arrived I opened the box and was thrilled with what I saw. I immediately jumped into the shower and installed the mirror using the included gel and tape that came with the mirror. I had some difficulty squeezing out the gel from the tube as it was stuck inside. I was not able to get all of the gel out of the tube but I went ahead and installed the mirror with the amount of gel I managed to squeeze out. This was a mistake and I should not have installed the mirror with the small amount I was able to squeeze out of the tube. Unfortunately, the next day the mirror fell to the shower floor. I decided to call ToiletTree Products and spoke with Kelly who is one of the owners. Kelly could not have been nicer on the phone and she sent me two additional tubes of the gel, and she explained to me that it is very important to use all of the adhesive gel so that the mirror would be secure and NEVER fall off the wall in the shower. Two days later the package arrived and I was able to squeeze out all the gel and installed the mirror once again. The mirror is firmly secured now and I can tell that it will never fall again. This is undoubtedly the best fogless mirror I have owned, and I have had many. The customer service at ToiletTree Products is fantastic. I could not be more delighted with my purchase and you will be too if you buy this lighted mirror from ToiletTree Products. I should add that Kelly also sent me a personal note along with a small gift. The note read... I have sent you this gift for any inconvenience you were caused due to the mirror falling from the shower wall.Just the note alone showed me how much ToiletTree Products cares about their customers. This company provides a great product and is a real class act!!!<br /><br />Peter
  505. Great product, however, I don't remember reading in the description that it was necessary to fill the resevoir in the back of the mirror to make it fogless.   520. -UPDATE 8/26/13-<br /><br />My original review is below the dotted line, in which I originally gave this item a two star rating due to some issues I had. I am happy to report that the company quickly resolved my issues.<br /><br />The issue that led to my review was that the adhesive that came with the product would not work for me, which led me to use super glue to hold the mirror up. The glue failed and the mirror fell, breaking my razor. The president of the company responded to my review and apologized and let me know that he wanted to help. I ended up receiving a new bracket with two tubes of adhesive and two pieces of sticky tape. I used the materials and got the mirror two stick. It's sticking to the wall like a rock actually, which is now making me wonder if I did something wrong the first time. I wonder if I didn't peel the cover of BOTH sides of the tape, which resulted in the bracket not sticking to the wall while the adhesive dried. If so, that's quite embarrassing and not the fault of the company.<br /><br />I also mentioned below that the pivoting mechanism seemed rather flimsy, and I'm happy to say that this replacement they sent me seems much sturdier.<br /><br />Anyways, now that the mirror is in place, I enjoy it quite a bit. I went over what I like about it in the older review below the dotted line, but I'll rattle them off again in a list here:<br /><br />1) Nice and large viewing area.<br />2) Stays completely fog-free as advertised. And this is the most important feature.<br />3) It has a shelf for my razor.<br />4) It has LED lights that do an adequate job of lighting up my face.<br />5) It has a squeegee for cleaning water droplets off the mirror. Very handy to have.<br />6) It's sticking to the wall VERY securely. This thing is not falling anytime soon, if ever.<br />7) Toilettree Products really does a good job listening to their customers, and are VERY quick about fixing any issues. A+ customer support!<br /><br />Now, let me list off some things that could be improved:<br /><br />1) While the shelf is nice, it should be bigger. It's kinda small, at least for my Gillette ProGlide 3-in-1 Styler monstrosity thing. It should have some kind of lip around the edge to minimize the risk of your razor falling off. Also a holder for a can of shaving cream would be nice.<br />2) Plastics feel too cheap for the price tag. This thing is pricey, and I feel that the materials it's made out of should reflect that. Maybe it should have a nice rubberized shelf so your razor won't slide around on it or soft touch surfaces around the edges for when you pick the mirror up to fill it with water. Some metal pieces incorporated into the design would be nice as well. It just needs something that shows/feels premium since this item carries a premium price tag.<br />3) The difference between the brightness settings for the LED lights is minimal. Like I said below, I had a hard time telling the difference.<br /><br />So as you can see, the positives far outweigh the negatives. This is a very smart idea that works, and has a company behind it that actually has quality customer support. Now I just have to see how this holds up over time.<br /><br />I highly recommend this mirror to anyone. As this company strives to improve their product, I can't wait to see what they will do next. Good job guys and gals!<br /><br />--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br /><br />-ORIGINAL REVIEW-<br /><br />I originally bought the cheaper non-lit version of this mirror a while back. It said that it was impossible for this mirror to fog up; and the claim was completely accurate. When filled with water, the mirror stayed clear for the entire duration of my shower. And the mirror was a generous size which is always nice.<br /><br />However, after about 3-4 months, I noticed that the mirrored surface was starting to erode away at the corners from the inside, and everytime I dumped the water out, little black flecks of stuff would fall out and go down the drain. I admit that I would leave the water in the mirror instead of dumping it out right away, so maybe that had something to do with the erosion, but still that is not an excuse for the degradation.<br /><br />So then I noticed that there was a \\"deluxe\\" LED-lit model of the mirror, and I bought it about 2-3 weeks ago thinking I would make sure to dump the water out right away to perhaps prevent the mirrored surface from eroding away again.<br /><br />I received the mirror, and was surprised to see it was even bigger than the first mirror, which was really nice. Then I tried to use the included adhesive to stick the mirror to the shower wall, and it wouldn't stick. It kept sliding down no matter how long I held it on the wall for. I never had this issue with the first mirror. So I eventually gave up and used super glue to stick it to the wall.<br /><br />Then the first time I filled the reservoir with water, it started leaking from FOUR(!) separate spots on the bottom. All the water would leak out within 1 minute. Also, the product was supposed to have two brightness settings for the LED lights, but this one only had one setting. It would only turn them on and then off again.<br /><br />I emailed the company and promptly received a replacement mirror. I filled it with water and it did not leak. It also had the two brightness setting as described, although the difference between the brightness setting was so minimal I spent a good five minutes trying to determine if there was really any difference at all between them.<br /><br />The shelf on this model was the same size as the first mirror I had, but because the mirror itself was bigger, it was harder to reach the shelf to put my razor on. But this wasn't a big issue to me.<br /><br />The pivoting mechanism on this model also seemed VERY flimsy, unlike the first mirror I had. I filled the mirror with water and used the included squeegee (nice touch) to clean the water droplets off the mirrored surface. In doing so, the mirror pivoted down from the position I wanted it in so I had to readjust the mirror.<br /><br />Now this morning, the mirror fell off the wall (remember I used super glue because the included adhesive wouldn't work for me)and broke my razor. The pivoting mechanism completely separated from the mirror, although I may be able to put it back together.<br /><br />I'm pretty ticked about the issues I've had with this mirror, partly due to the price of it. This is a LOT of money for a shower mirror. The concept is genius, but the build quality is not representative of the price tag. You are paying for the idea of it; not the quality. Such a shame.e mirrored surface was starting to erode away at the corners from the inside, and everytime I dumped the water out, little black flecks of stuff would fall out and go down the drain. I admit that I would leave the water in the mirror instead of dumping it out right away, so maybe that had something to do with the erosion, but still that is not an excuse for the degradation.<br /><br />So then I noticed that there was a \\"deluxe\\" LED-lit model of the mirror, and I bought it about 2-3 weeks ago thinking I would make sure to dump the water out right away to perhaps prevent the mirrored surface from eroding away again.<br /><br />I received the mirror, and was surprised to see it was even bigger than the first mirror, which was really nice. Then I tried to use the included adhesive to stick the mirror to the shower wall, and it wouldn't stick. It kept sliding down no matter how long I held it on the wall for. I never had this issue with the first mirror. So I eventually gave up and used super glue to stick it to the wall.<br /><br />Then the first time I filled the reservoir with water, it started leaking from FOUR(!) separate spots on the bottom. All the water would leak out within 1 minute. Also, the product was supposed to have two brightness settings for the LED lights, but this one only had one setting. It would only turn them on and then off again.<br /><br />I emailed the company and promptly received a replacement mirror. I filled it with water and it did not leak. It also had the two brightness setting as described, although the difference between the brightness setting was so minimal I spent a good five minutes trying to determine if there was really any difference at all between them.<br /><br />The shelf on this model was the same size as the first mirror I had, but because the mirror itself was bigger, it was harder to reach the shelf to put my razor on. But this wasn't a big issue to me.<br /><br />The pivoting mechanism on this model also seemed VERY flimsy, unlike the first mirror I had. I filled the mirror with water and used the included squeegee (nice touch) to clean the water droplets off the mirrored surface. In doing so, the mirror pivoted down from the position I wanted it in so I had to readjust the mirror.<br /><br />Now this morning, the mirror fell off the wall (remember I used super glue because the included adhesive wouldn't work for me)and broke my razor. The pivoting mechanism completely separated from the mirror, although I may be able to put it back together.<br /><br />I'm pretty ticked about the issues I've had with this mirror, partly due to the price of it. This is a LOT of money for a shower mirror. The concept is genius, but the build quality is not representative of the price tag. You are paying for the idea of it; not the quality. Such a shame.
  521. I ordered this mirror for my husband who shaves in the shower (heavy beard). Anyway, it went together quickly, and works perfectly. I asked him to rate it, and he said &#34;Give it five stars!&#34;. It doesn't fog up like the one it replaced because you fill the back of it with water. When I asked my husband if he thought that the filling and emptying was a nuisance, he said, &#34;not in the least.&#34; As for the lighting, it also is perfect. His old mirror lit from the bottom and would shut off after an allotted amount of time. This mirror lights completely around its perimeter giving the user better lighting, and the switch is manual. The user just shuts it off when finished. So, all that said, my husband recommends this mirror for anyone who needs a mirror in the shower. NOTE: One reviewer remarked on the width vs. height, stating that the mirror should be taller rather than wider. My husband finds the dimensions perfect. After thinking on it myself, I can see that the height issue might be important for a man who shaves his head. Still, the mirror tilts and should accommodate that issue as well. In any case, I don't believe anyone who orders this mirror will be disappointed.
  522. I purchased this about a year ago, and have loved it from the very 1st. Its a great product at a reasonable price. So why am I leaving a review now after a year. Well unfortunately about a week or so ago the led lights stopped working. And of course I'm just out of my warranty period (it ended 1 month ago). Just for kicks I sent an email to Toilettree and well boy was I surprised. Within minutes of having sent the email I received a reply and the reply was try new batteries (which I had already done), if that doesn't fix the problem they would send me a new one. No questions asked. And yes I did mention in my original email that I was out of the warranty period. So to sum up its a great product/makes shaving in the shower easy to do. And perhaps even better than the product is the customer service.
  523. I have had the standard version of this mirror for about six months. I bought this version because it is a little dark where I mounted the first mirror. (I was able to use the same mount for this Deluxe version.) I am somewhat disappointed because I don't find that the light is bright enough on my face to make much difference. Moreover, it bizarrely has a low setting which means that to turn the light off you have to push the button twice. The larger size of the mirror is of no benefit to me.<br /><br />I love shaving in the shower and these mirrors stay free of fog. I recommend buying the standard version and trying to mount it somewhere where the light is decent. Also, if you mount it close to the shower head (so that you can since the razor) you will get more water drops on the mirror, which may leave deposits when the water evaporates. They are pretty easily cleaned though.
  524. The mount eventually fell off my bathroom wall after about 6 months of use. 11/04/14 Update - Company reached out to me regarding my issue and will resend the mounting kit, changing my rating to 5 stars, excellent customer service.
  525. If you have a hard time shaving like a regular person that does not have sensitive skin, this might be a good solution for you that shaves while showering. Easy setup (read the instructions) and very functional system to avoid mirror fog. Works like a charm!
  526. Don't know that I'd actually call it fogless, but I don't think there really is such a thing. To make it fogless, one has to fill it with warm water. At that point, it becomes a carnival mirror and distorts your face. The light makes it even harder to see yourself, believe it or not.<br /><br />Having said all that, I really do like this mirror. It's large, easily removed from the base to wash off the fog, and gets the job done. It also seals to the wall very well with the provided silicone.
  527. After about 20 days the LED's stopped working all together, I tried replacing the batteries/cleaned the inside, setting it out of the shower in hopes it would dry out, nothing fixed the LED lights. As for the fogless mirror part it works very well, Id give it a 5 start in a heart beat if it wasn't for the LED's going out in less than a month.
  528. The concept is good, and the mirror works fog free as advertised but after 6 months of use the adjustable brackets that allow you to position the mirror can no longer support the weigh of the water. My mirror now points towards the floor and won't prop up unless I put something behind it to support it. I'm very pleased with the item and more so with the customer service. Why is this still a two star rating?   535. I originally purchased this mirror for my husband in December 2011. The mirror has worked great and I have enjoyed using it as well because I could pivot the mirror down for my height. Unfortunately for the past several months, when water is added to prevent the mirror from fogging up, the tilt hinge no longer can hold the mirror up. So know the mirror faces downward making it impossible to use if water is added. Given the price I certainly would have hoped it would work for more than two years. I recently purchased another Pivoting Deluxe LED Fogless Shower Mirror for my sister, hopefully that one will last longer.
  536. Reading the reviews, this seemed like the perfect shower mirror. Unfortunately, it's not much of a mirror at all.   537. Very useful product, arrived on time.
  538. I've had this product for a few months now and the light has already burnt out on the second setting. I REALLY like the concept of using a mirror in the shower and having a light. The way the water doesn't made the mirror fog is great. I just wish it would have lasted longer!!!
  539. The product works okay but for $50 I expected something that required less routine upkeep. For every use you have to take it off the wall before your shower, fill it with hot water, place it back on the wall, use the squeegee a couple of times during the shower, then empty it and wipe it down at the end. If you don't perform every step every time it is useless. I neglected to wipe it dry after one shower and it was covered in water spots. Since the mirror already has batteries it seems that they could be utilized to heat the mirror. The hot water routine seems so low tech. If it had cost $15 then I wouldn't complain but this is advertised as if it is the most modern, deluxe product on the market. It is not. I like the fact that it does not use suction cups so it definitely will not fall off the wall. On the other hand, I don't expect this product to last over a year. When it is no longer useful it will still be permanently attached to my ceramic tile. If I realized this earlier I would not have mounted it.
  540. Bought this Deluxe LED mirror in March 2012. Used it for four months. Mirror works as advertized and remains fog free, however the lights no longer work. I would recommend not buying the LED mirror.
  541. Fast delivery but I am a bit disappointed due to the fact it didnt meet my expectations. I think its a cheap product and I can get a better shave with a pocket sized mirror. Fogless mirror, ha.. you have to put hot water in the mirror for it to be fogless. Waste of time, Waste of money.
  542. Bought this after returning a \\"fogless\\" mirror that fogged even before i turned the shower on. This thing just works, no fog ever, the light is great, and the squeegee squeegees!   543. The mirror has been in use for about 8 months now. Initially, it was the best shower mirror I've ever owned. Worked just as advertised and I was very happy. Then after 3-4 months of use, the swivel in the back started to get worn out. Now, it's worn to the point that it doesn't even hold the mirror upright when the water reservoir is filled. I have to put a sponge behind the mirror to keep it upright. Also, the compartment which held the batteries leaked about 5 months in (and yes, I made sure the cover was LOCKED). Opened the compartment one day and found the batteries corroded by moisture. Great concept but falls a little short of expectations.<br /><br />The company contacted me wanting to replace the swivel mount. They sent me a new one but again, a few months later it began to wear down and lost its functionality. Good customer service.
  544. I followed all of the directions exept for one... It was physically impossible to get more than 40-50% of the adhesive out of the tube and it wasn't for lack of effort. I am a 34 year old, 220 lb. man. I went and got a pliers and eventually stood on the little tube, balancing on the heel of one foot... That stuff was not coming out of there. Apparently it had cured in the tube while it sat in the warehouse.<br /><br />I tried to stick the mirror up there with what would come out of the tube and the next day (today) it made it about 5 minutes into my shower before falling. At least it didn't break. I'll try getting more adhesive from the company or maybe try crazy glue...<br /><br />For the five minutes it was on the wall it did work like a charm though.   546. This is a good product and before people start bashing my review, please understand that 1) I will not respond to idiotic trollish comments and 2) These are called \\"reviews\\" for a reason and i am entitled to my opinion and judgment.<br /><br />That being said, this is a great product. Works flawlessly, great build quality, great packaging and from my research, a great customer service department. I have used this mirror for a few weeks now and have taken a star each for the following 2 reasons:<br /><br />1) The LED lights do not really work or enhance anything. Reminds me of a \\"light up\\" license place bracket that you see on cars, gives it a cosmetic appeal but no real benefits. I wish the designers had tested it out on consumers as the LED lights would have worked better if they were focused out instead of focused in towards the mirror. All the lights do is give the mirror somewhat of a \\"Halo\\" effect.<br /><br />2) Charging almost $50.00 for adding a few LED lights (that do not help) that cost pennies and a slightly larger surface area is absurd.<br /><br />I do not have the time or patience to return this and order a non LED mirror.<br /><br />All in all, i would definitely go with the non LED version of this product as it works as advertised and is a great product. This alone deserves 5 stars. Only time will tell how long this replacement will last but the build seems solid and the hinge problem has been fixed.<br /><br />Thank You Steve for following up with your customers. A good product with great customer service is what the market lags and your company is definitely on the better end of the spectrum.<br /><br />Cheers!last but the build seems solid and the hinge problem has been fixed.<br /><br />Thank You Steve for following up with your customers.   556. Good Points: Looks like Ad. Hangs properly. Does not fog. Simple to use.<br />Bad Points: Design flaws. Does have some \\"Fun-House Mirror\\" effect because the mirror is thin plastic. Mirror gets covered in water droplets to the point that you have to splash water on it to see yourself again. Squeegee is of moderate use. Whole mirrored unit sticks out several inches from the wall. Mirror lights are of zero use in a normally lit bathroom - but OK if showering in the dark. Tip: Hang right at eye level (or a tiny bit lower) if possible. Hang too high, tilting down: Mirror will bulge, giving fish-eye effect. Hang too low, tilting upward: Mirror will center-decompress, giving satellite-dish effect. Remember: The water's weight dominates the mirror. Overall: Product is OK, but wait for a sale - product is not worth $50. I considered sending it back, but part of the unit was already stuck to the shower wall - so I kept it. I had higher hopes for this product. :(
  557. This mirror seemed like a great thing from the reviews, and I was excited to install it. But the mirror is made of plastic (which I assume is necessary to allow the hot shower water to warm it up to prevent fogging), and I was quite disappointed with the image. The reflection distorts your face and makes it look SMALLER, which is the opposite of what you want to shave with. The other disappointment is the the LED lights are woefully inadequate. If your face is three inches away from the mirror, a little light shines on it, but any further and there's no light at all. I find standing that close the the mirror claustrophobic and annoying. On the plus side, it has a nice-looking frame, a large (albeit distorted) mirror, and a well-designed shelf and mounting bracket.<br /><br />I'm returning this mirror and going back to my cheap glass mirror that I let soak in the shower water, squeegee off, and set on a shelf to shave with.
  558. The mirror requires that you empty a tube of silicone caulk on your shower wall to install the mirror's mount. Each time you want to use the mirror you have to clean the mirror and fill it with hot water. If you forget to empty the mirror you have to pour cold water out on the floor next time you use fill the mirror. Good quality material but inconvenient design.
  559. The concept itself is great. I just got mine and it worked great for keeping the fog off the mirror, 30mins with increase in temp and no build up. BUT here is the problem!! I bought this as a mirror and the mirror on this item is terrible!! Its one of those warped ones that make your face look small in the middle and big everywhere else. I dont know if this on purpose so people look thinner or maybe I got a bad one?? But I hate it!! I have to get my face very close to see where I'm shaving without everything being distorted.   560. It does the job! Would like it be a thinner profile, and the tilt needs to be improved but I love it and will recommend to my friends!
  561. I have purchased many &#34;fogless&#34; mirrors in the past...none of them work. Don't get me wrong, they are good for a month or so, but then...<br /><br />This one, because you fill it with warm water, actually solves the problem. Fog occurs because of the temperature difference. Without getting into a physics lesson, condensate (fog) forms on a cooler surface because, as the water in the air cools, it forms droplets, thus clouding your mirror.<br /><br />This mirror is designed that you fill with warm/hot water when getting in the shower. Because the mirror is warmed by the water, it stays of even enought temperature with the shower, that no condensate (fog) occurs.<br /><br />Great design and flawless execution. This will be my last shaving mirror.
  562. High quality and as described. It comes with the epoxy glue. No complaint so far.
  563. Have tried several in the shower mirrors and none worked until this one. It actually does not fog up and was easy to install.
  564. This item arrived a few days before expected, which made me happy as it was going to be part of my husbands birthday gift. He has always shaved in the shower, but has never had a mirror that does not fog up or stay put on the wall until I purchased this one. It hasn't budged after I mounted it, and so far, has never fogged up. My husband is extremely pleased with this shower mirror.
  565. Pros:<br />-Great, wide mirror<br />-quality product<br />-Tool-less installation<br />-Ability to permanently mount<br /><br />Cons:<br />-Only rotates vertically, cannot put in corner of shower.<br />-LED light is too centered<br />-Light Level \\"toggle\\" is not noticeable.<br /><br />Overall, the product with the added light is not preferable as the LED shines directly into your pupils during shaving. The light is also too dim over 3 feet away, making avoiding your pupils all but impossible.   567. I bought this for my husband for Christmas. He loves it. It really does work and never fogs. It's big too which is nice.
  568. This product actually works. It does require a semi-permanent attachment to your tile or wall surface with a silicone adhesive. Not sure about removable. Make sure you test the height you want it before you attach it. But it does not fog, is large enough to shave comfortably and has a relatively distortion free viewing area. It has a shelf to hold your razor and a designed place to hang the squeegee. It sticks out from the wall about 3 inches in order for it to be able to use the tilt feature. You fill the built in container behind the mirror with hot water and there is no fog at all. I am pleasantly surprised by the quality and functionality of this product. And the shipping was amazing. I used regular amazon shipping and it was here the next day. What more can you ask, great product, good value, works just like claimed and superb service. I'm recommending it to my friends. If you shave in the shower, this product works.

  570. I bought this as one of my husband's Christmas presents as he requested a fogless shower mirror. I ended up researching each and every brand out there for HOURS before making a purchasing decision. Let me tell you, this is the ONLY product which consistently had extremely positive reviews, was confirmed to be fogless without the use of any additional sprays/products, and their customer service is excellent. We've had the product for 3 months now and it is still hanging beautifully in the shower, great big size, absolutely fogless, easy to maintain, LED lights are a plus. I really can't say enough positive things about this product, I am 100% happy with my purchase and my husband loves it!   571. This mirror was VERY simple to put together. I applied the adhesive and stuck the bracket to the shower wall, waited 24 hours and put the mirror on the bracket. It held just fine, even with the reservoir completely full. Although this version is 20% bigger than the original, it fits in my small shower quite nicely and will be very convenient for tweezing my eyebrows. As you can see from the picture it is VERY clean and clear. The only downfall is remembering to fill the reservoir with water before each use to keep it fogless, but other than that, this product is pretty great.<br /><br />The BEST part about the LED fogless shower mirror is the fact that my husband can now shave in the shower, and it will result in a much easier clean up. I very much dislike having to clean the sink after every shave. I enjoy the cool illumination the LED lights provide also. It tends to be a little darker in the shower since we don't have a light directly above, so this mirror brightens it up a bit!
  572. Very nice quality. Not exactly fogless though.
  573. Have been shaving in the shower for 15 years -- moisture in beard is the most important variable in getting a great shave. Mirror works as advertised -- does not fog, does not fall off wall. The tube of silicon was hardened when it arrived -- called the company and they immediately sent another one. As another reviewer suggested, mirror would be better with short side up, would fit face better. Also,if it had a magnifying feature, that would make it absolutely perfect. All in all, an excellent product! BTW, I use the Gillette Fusion shaver with a built-in light, from The Art of Shaving, and the following shave creams: Burts Bees, Aveda, RS (from Rite Aid), Kiss My Face. RS is the least expensive, but Rite Aid never stocks much of it.Burts Bees and Kiss My Face are reasonable, Aveda is fairly expensive. The key to good shaving with creams is to not use too much, so the razor doesn't clog.<br /><br />Update 12/12/12: Mirror no longer holds its position and flops down. I have to hold it vertical with one hand and shave with the other. Called the company and they immediately agreed to send a new piece with a stronger ratchet. No argument or documentation required. Good service!<br /><br />Update 12/18/12: The new plastic piece arrived and easily slid into place. Mirror now works perfectly. Great service. I think over time it's a good idea to shift the mirror's position gently, as the plastic may wear out easily. BTW, I like the lights!
  574. Day 1: I received this item in the mail a few hours ago. Out of the box I noticed a scratch on the frame of the mirror but decided it will be forgotten in time. I followed the directions, cleaned the wall surface with soap and water, then with alcohol and waited for the surface to dry. When I tried to apply the silicon glue to the frame I realized the contents of the tube were dried up, nothing was coming out and it was completely useless. Fortunately I had some Gorilla glue and used that in combination with the sticky back tape that came in the box to attach the frame to the tiled wall. I immediately realized the plastic frame is not straight. Trying to push it down to the tile was a complete waste of time and eventually I had to settle for holding it down with some masking tape. I will remove the tape to see how well it is attached tomorrow and will share the rest of my findings then. So far, I will give it a generous 1 out of 5.<br /><br />Day 2: My substitute gorilla glue has dried and I attached the mirror. After an hour run on the treadmill it was time to take a shower and give the new mirror a try. I followed the instructions, removed the mirror and filled the reservoir in the back with warm water from the shower and true to their word the mirror did not fog up once during my long hot shower! I shaved with the LED lights on and it was nice to actually see me face clearly for a change :) I had been using the same old Z'fogless mirror for a few years and it was pretty scratched up from falling and a bit tarnished from constant humidity. So, I upgrade my rating from 1 to 3 stars and will hold my final judgement until more use. I should also note that I received a very timely response to my initial post from the President of the company owning up to the problems and willing to do whatever is necessary to make things right with me. I have to admit that kind of customer service is very nice and representative of a caring company. I have a few thoughts/suggestions to make this a better product. Some of these may prove to be unnecessary after further use but here they are anyways:<br /><br />1. Better quality of glue or perhaps two tubes from different batches/suppliers in case one is dried up :)<br /><br />2. Better quality control to make sure there are no scratches on the mirror or its frame. This may be very difficult to do as I am sure they are manufactured in China and are handled by people during assembly and packing so it is impossible to avoid a few small scratches every once in a while. Having said that, for this amount of money at retail I think a perfect product is more fitting and expected. Those with tiny scratches and other small imperfections can be sold through liquidators and in other markets at lesser prices.<br /><br />3. I am a bit concerned about the wear and tear of the plastic tilting mechanism over time. Using metal parts would have been worse given rusting problems but perhaps making that portion removable and replaceable would be a good idea for the next generation. Also, it is hard to remove the mirror without causing some tilting as it is sort of flimsy. Perhaps this is an area where some improvement can be made in the next version.<br /><br />4. I realize filling the reservoir with hot water is the key to keeping the mirror from fogging up but perhaps there is a better way to empty and refill the reservoir without having to remove it and having to deal with all the tilting issues and any chances of dropping and scratching the mirror. A tube with a valve at the bottom of the mirror can be used to drain the reservoir and another with a large funnel like top can be used to refill it. I realize this is a rather rudimentary approach but I am sure the designers of the product can think of more innovative approaches to tackle this challenge.<br /><br />5. Having batteries in any device near the shower and water and keeping them from rusting is rather challenging. We will see how well these are sealed overtime.<br /><br />In conclusion, after one use, the mirror works as advertised and the lighting is a nice useful feature. I will update my findings over time so stay tuned. Of course my wife still has to use it and she may have a thing or two to add :)<br /><br />Week 2: The Gorilla glue I used to attach the mirror base to the wall has held up fine and when filled with warm water the mirror does not fog but that is all the positives I can say about it while giving myself credit for using a better grade of glue since I had no choice. Unfortunately, already the mirror can not hold the weight of the water it needs in order of it to work as advertised. This is due to the cheap plastic mechanism used to set the angle of the mirror which I do not change but gets moved everyday when I have to remove the old water and add fresh warm water. Further, the adding and emptying of water has become a time consuming pain which requires one to also wipe the water drops from the surface of the mirror. The supplied blade is also not perfect in removing the water from the surface and leaves many trails on the mirror. A better design would have used batteries and an electrical filament to heat the back of the mirror quickly even if it would have required more or separate batteries. In all, I find this mirror to be of very poor quality and am going to send it back. I only hope to be able to remove the base from the wall without breaking it or leaving a mark on the tiles. Btw, it was nice to hear back from the President of the company after my first post but there was absolutely no follow up after that. I suppose it was all for show specially since he did not even leave his email address. It is a real shame! In conclusion: \\"This one belongs to the horror files\\".<br /><br />2/15/13: The President of the Company, Steve, stayed in touch with me to see how my experience was. After pointing out the deficiencies he immediately sent me an improved mirror that fixed all the issues. I have been using the new mirror for a few weeks and it is flawless. Thank you Steve for an incredible customer support, continuing to listen to your customers and improving your products. I will not think twice about ordering products from you in the future!
  575. The fogless mirror works just as advertised. Everything is provided for easy and secure installation. Just great. If I needed another fog less mirror I would buy another one of these. Easy to operate and great to use.
  576. It works as it should, but I just attempted to replace the batteries and the plastic knobs on the back came off. So now I have no way of opening the battery compartment and changing the batteries.
  577. I was excited to find this and hear some positive reviews. I found customer service very good initially when the tube of silicone was hardened. They sent it right out, nice attitude on the phone. Once I had hooked the support to the wall and filled the resevoir with water it didn't fog. And here it is the thing that makes this product a total pass. Once filled with water it weighs more, and the engineers designed for no extra weight. So the adjustable angle bracket which would work empty, now flops toward the ground and unless you want to shave your toe hairs is completely useless. I am handy with fixes but since it is only light plastic I am not about to use wood shims etc. to fix it, because the whole design is so lightweight.<br /> I don't see how some reviews didn't go into this issue more, but with the upper end model that I bought it is a total failure and a no buy. Sorry. Return time.<br /> Oh yes one more bit of info. When I called them about this, i got no answer all day long. Left a message, no answer. Customer service fell off.<br /><br />Update: They did contact me when they saw my review and were very helpful.They sent a new stronger biting piece and lo and behold the mirror is now adjustable and stays where you set it. Now I can say this product is great. Thanks<br /> I change my review to 4 stars<br /><br />Update Jan 2013 Mirror works very nice. I find it even simpler to let the mirror warm up while I shower and shave at the end. I just take the mirror off, squeegy it, don't bother filling it with water, and shave . The mirror doesn't fog and I save wear and tear on the hardware, and save time. Works just as well as filling and emptying the resevoir everytime. Have fun.
  578. I have loved shaving in shower for 30 years - bought this to replace a mirror I have had for 20 years - the silicone glue came all dried up but unexpectedly rec'd an e-mail from a company rep who fixed the problem immediately - very impressed by that. Once I got the glue and got the mirror up on my tile shower wall it has been nice to use.
  579. Whether you have a fogless shower mirror, or are looking to get your first one, you can't go wrong with ToiletTree's Deluxe LED Fogless Shower Mirror. This is essentially the upgraded version of their basic Fogless Shower Mirror; this product is basically the same, except that it's bigger, and it has the distinct and most definite advantage of having a bright white LED led that goes around all four sides of the mirror.<br /><br />Installation of this mirror is a breeze - use the included adhesive, or do a bit of an upgrade, as my husband often does, with a bit of super glue (just make sure you're happy with where you're placing it in your shower!). When you fill the back reservoir with water, the temperature/humidity on both sides of the mirror is essentially \\"equalized\\", thus eliminating all but perhaps miniscule traces of fog. Water droplets may gather on the surface of the mirror, but if you periodically \\"pre-treat\\" the mirror with actual windshield washer fluid, you'll find that the water beads up and runs off a lot better.<br /><br />The LED light is white and bright - the lower setting is just fine, though of course depending on your bathroom lighting you may want to use the brighter setting (particularly at night). The lighting is a very nice inclusion, as it makes shaving (for him) and facial tweezing (for her) SO much easier.<br /><br />Last but not least, the included squeegee does an excellent job of cleaning the mirror surface.
  580. When I tried to install my mirror I discovered that the supplied silicon was dried up and could not be used. I called the company and they sent out a new one, no questions asked. They also sent a HAND WRITTEN note and gave me a free gift(nail clippers) for my trouble! OUTSTANDING! I am happy with the mirror too.
  581. Best shower mirror that I have tried to date. Very clear. Lights could be a little brighter but still soft similar to my wife's make-up mirror. My previous mirror had bright led lights but they shined in my eyes like headlights on high beam making it difficult to see anything.
  582. This has to be the umpteenth shower mirror I have tried. This one works! First, it actually sticks to the wall without falling off. Second, it is simple. Just fill it with warm water and it stays fog free for the whole time. What a concept! Just don't clean it with anything but the squeegee supplied with it. I got the lighted one. Didn't really need the light but it seemed like a good idea.
  583. This review will be categorical, detailing specific points of interest for this product.<br /><br />-In the Box-<br /><br />The contents of the box included everything that was needed to both mount and operate this device: mounting bracket, mirror unit, 3xAA batteries, squeegee, and silicone adhesive. The instructions for mounting and operation are what we have all undoubtedly come to expect, which is brief; however, the instructions were detailed and consise enough to leave no one confused about how to either instal or use this device.<br /><br />-Installation-<br /><br />The installation instructions call for the use of the adhesive squares attached to the rear of the mounting bracket, as well as the application of the included adhesive silicone. It is important to note here that I DID NOT follow these instructions when mounting this product. Instead, I used Command waterproof mounting strips found below. If you are in any way uncertain when installing this product, I do advise that you follow the included instructions to the letter, as I have likely voided the product warranty by doing what I did.<br /><br />You are going to want to first prep the surface of the shower prior to using any method of installation where adhesive makes contact with the shower wall. As I am sure we are all aware, repeated use of our showers results in this wonderful film that we must clean periodically. Applying any adhesive to that film will cause the adhesive to bond to it, rather than the wall surface. I used a healthy amount of Windex Commercial, because it contains ammonia. Why? Because a good portion of the cleaners we use on a daily basis leave a residue of thier own, which can and will interfere with adhesion. I allowed the Windex to sit on the surface for approximately 2-3 minutes before using an abrasive pad to scrub the wall. I then used a dry cloth to wipe away the moisture before using an alcohol prep pad on the surface I had just cleaned. The instructions do call for the use of alcohol, and you may find this an unnecessary step, here's why it isn't: when exposed to air, alcohol evaporates without leaving any sort of residue, which ensures that the adhesive can bond directly to the surface it is being applied to.<br /><br />Once the surface was cleaned, I removed the adhesive squares from the back of the mounting bracket, replacing them with the Command mounting strips (see included picture for placement). I allowed the shower wall and mounting strips approximately 2-3 minutes before applying the bracket to the shower wall. I then applied pressure to the bracket, to seat the mounting strips, for appoximately 30 seconds. At this point I applied pressure to the tray on the bracket to ensure a solid bond before hanging the mirror unit.<br /><br />You will notice that I again applied pressure to the tray on the bracket once the mirror unit was in place (see included picture), deflecting the tray quite a bit. I did this to demonstrate the effectiveness of the above installation. While I have no doubt this unit will stay where it is until the end of time (I have hung heavy LED units with command strips that are in place after over a year), there is absolutely nothing wrong with the recommended installation. The adhesive squares in combination with the silicone will hold the unit in place so long as you properly prep the surface. I have read a few reviews of people gripping about the unit not staying in place, and that is because they didn't properly prepare the surface. You can glue a Buick to the side of a building, so long as the surface is properly prepared (Of course, there are other considerations when one decides to glue a car to a building, but I think you get my point).<br /><br />Command Strips: http://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B000WSNM9Q/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1<br /><br />-In the Shower-<br /><br />Filling the unit is pretty straightfoward and easy, with the top of the unit housing a fairly large opening to accomodate filling. I used hot water as instructed, and was surprised that the only thing that wound up on the surface of the mirror were water dropplets from splashing. I have used other units, even units that continiously cycle water behind the mirror, and all of them have devolped \\"fog\\". Using the mirror was pretty simple, though it is constructed in such a way as to magnify your face (or whatever you happen to want to aim the mirror at), so you do need to be standing fairly close to get an undistorted reflection. The magnification made shaving my face easier than using a conventional wall mirror, primarily because I could literally see the pores in my face. As I mentioned, water droplets did form on the surface of the mirror, and the included squeegee worked to clear them . The squeegee is not long enough to clear the mirror in one pass, but I didn't have to spend more than a few seconds using it to get a clear reflection. All in all, I was pleased with the mirror.<br /><br />-The Light-<br /><br />The light on the mirror is simple to activate, and is bright enough to illuminate your face if you need it. I have a light built in to my shower, so I found no benefit in having a lit mirror. If you shower in a cave however, you will likely find it quite useful. The button on the side of the unit used to activate the light is easy to access, and doesn't provide so much resistance that you need to be concerned with displacing the mirror.<br /><br />-The Pivot-<br /><br />The mounting bracket has a built in pivot you can used to adjust the angle of the mirror up and down, which I found to be quite useful. Not only was I able to use the mirror to shave my face, but the angle of the mirror also allowed me to groom my chest as well. I suppose it goes without saying, but you could potentially use this mirror to shave any body reqion you so desired, depending on the mounting location of the mirror. I noticed a few reviews that mentioned the noise the pivot makes when using it, as well as the fear of catastrophic failure as a result. The pivot has teeth and uses friction to hold the mirror at the desired angle, so that is the \\"snapping\\" sound heard when adjusting the angle. I played with the pivot pretty vigorously, and the mirror didn't snap free and become airborn, so I don't think you have anything to worry about.<br /><br />-The Tray-<br /><br />The tray that is part of the mounting bracket is plastic, but fairly rigid. I was able to apply a good bit of pressure to the tray without causing a great deal of deflection. Given the space between the mirror unit and the tray, you will have no issue storing your razor as depicted. The tray will accomodate any small item(s) not prone to rolling without concern of the tray deflecting and dropping it.<br /><br />-Conclussions-<br /><br />All in all, this is an excellent product that does everything that it claims to do. The mirror and the mounting braket are solidly made, and the anti-fog system works flawlessly in my experience. The magnification and pivot make the mirror fairly versatile. It is easy to instal, easy to fill, and easy to maintain; which makes this mirror worth the price-point.s surprised that the only thing that wound up on the surface of the mirror were water dropplets from splashing. I have used other units, even units that continiously cycle water behind the mirror, and all of them have devolped \\"fog\\". Using the mirror was pretty simple, though it is constructed in such a way as to magnify your face (or whatever you happen to want to aim the mirror at), so you do need to be standing fairly close to get an undistorted reflection. The magnification made shaving my face easier than using a conventional wall mirror, primarily because I could literally see the pores in my face. As I mentioned, water droplets did form on the surface of the mirror, and the included squeegee worked to clear them . The squeegee is not long enough to clear the mirror in one pass, but I didn't have to spend more than a few seconds using it to get a clear reflection. All in all, I was pleased with the mirror. -The Light- The light on the mirror is simple to activate, and is bright enough to illuminate your face if you need it. I have a light built in to my shower, so I found no benefit in having a lit mirror. If you shower in a cave however, you will likely find it quite useful. The button on the side of the unit used to activate the light is easy to access, and doesn't provide so much resistance that you need to be concerned with displacing the mirror. -The Pivot- The mounting bracket has a built in pivot you can used to adjust the angle of the mirror up and down, which I found to be quite useful. Not only was I able to use the mirror to shave my face, but the angle of the mirror also allowed me to groom my chest as well. I suppose it goes without saying, but you could potentially use this mirror to shave any body reqion you so desired, depending on the mounting location of the mirror. I noticed a few reviews that mentioned the noise the pivot makes when using it, as well as the fear of catastrophic failure as a result. The pivot has teeth and uses friction to hold the mirror at the desired angle, so that is the \\"snapping\\" sound heard when adjusting the angle. I played with the pivot pretty vigorously, and the mirror didn't snap free and become airborn, so I don't think you have anything to worry about. -The Tray- The tray that is part of the mounting bracket is plastic, but fairly rigid. I was able to apply a good bit of pressure to the tray without causing a great deal of deflection. Given the space between the mirror unit and the tray, you will have no issue storing your razor as depicted. The tray will accomodate any small item(s) not prone to rolling without concern of the tray deflecting and dropping it. -Conclussions- All in all, this is an excellent product that does everything that it claims to do. The mirror and the mounting braket are solidly made, and the anti-fog system works flawlessly in my experience. The magnification and pivot make the mirror fairly versatile. It is easy to instal, easy to fill, and easy to maintain; which makes this mirror worth the price-point.
  584. I really liked this mirror when i first got it. It was bright and the anti-fog system works great. However, over the past few months that i've owned it the \\"gears\\" that hold the mirror in position have stripped and now the mirror won't stay up. In other workds, the mirror can be roated up and down so you can see yourself, but that is all stripped and the mirror just points at the floor. It started to do that when there was water in the mirror (it it heavier when filled with water - duh), but now it doesn't even stay up when it's empty. The other thing is that if you leave the light on even once, the batteries will be completely run down. Some kind of timer switch would be a nice feature, because most of us shave first thing in the morning (sleepy) and leaving a faint light on in the shower seems like something we would all do at some point. Nice idea, but product didn't last. Now I have to figure out how to uninstall the bracket - which by the way is stuck on with silicone.

  590. I've had my eye on this mirror for over a year and a half to replace one from another manufacturer which I used for close to 10 years. Reading reviews on this mirror and feeling confident that IF there were problems, the manufacturer would stand behind their product, I finally purchased it. I have only had it for about 2 weeks and it does work as advertised, simple to use, clear image with no fogging as expected. Pleasantly surprised that the mirror did come with batteries. That being said, the tube of silicone was virtually empty when I opened it, maybe about ⅜\\" of silicone bead came out. I can see where this would be a problem for most people. In my business, I use silicone, so I just used my own. As to the claim that the LED light button on the side clicks thru a high intensity, low intensity and off... mine just is off and on. There is only one intensity. The 4 corners and 2 more LED lights on each edge light up. The light output and the clarity of the mirror are more than ample for shaving as is. I did phone the company and Gary Parisi, the CEO, answered the phone on the second ring. He confirmed the lighting arrangement and told me they did change the lighting due to customer feedback about having to click thru 2 light settings, thinking they had turned it off and finding dead batteries due to leaving the light on it's lowest setting. He said they were in the process of changing the description and the instructions to reflect this product change. Hopefully, they will get to the root of the problem with the silicone tube supplier. As for me, that wasn't a deal killer, but for most other people, I could see that they could be dismayed at having to wait for replacement silicone or have to buy their own. Mr Parisi did offer to send out the silicone right away, but I told him it wasn't necessary. Wonderful customer service, concerned about their product and wanting to make sure their customers are happy is what separates the great companies from the rest of the pack.

I would recommend following all the installation instructions, including cleaning the wall and bracket thoroughly, and consider purchasing a third party silicone adhesive and applying liberally.

Usually you have to dig to find that stuff, but as soon as you open the box you get a big stop sign with a number to help you with anything. The mirrors are pretty big, like the size of a 3rd or 4th generation iPad, so you see your face very well. These mirrors also simply do not got up.   616. Let me begin by saying I purchased this product in 2011. I had begun shaving my head, and wanted a fogless mirror for the shower. The product is well built, looks good, the mirror is distortion free and i was very happy with the product.<br /><br />About a year later, i renovated the whole bathroom with a stall shower and new tile. I contacted ToiletTree to ask if i could buy a new silicone adhesive tube or could they recommend one i could pick up in the hardware store. Their customer service e-mailed me within 2 hours to tell me the stand behind their products and sent me a new adhesive kit for free.<br /><br />It is now 3 full years after my purchase, and I emailed them again last night. I'd like to share my email and the response<br />I recieved...<br /><br />Hello,<br />I ordered this product back in 2011 so it really doesn't owe me anything. I wanted to make you aware that the battery compartment leaked and the led's no longer work. A bigger concern is that the ratchet that holds the mirror at an angle has become so loose that when the mirror is full of water, it can no longer support the weight and tilts all the way down. I love the product, and was just wondering if there was anything you could do for me or tell me a fix for tightening the bracket before I purchase a replacement. Thanks in advance,<br />Neil Fishman<br /><br />Good morning Neil -<br /><br />I am very sorry about this. The good thing about owning a product from ToiletTree Products is that we will always stand behind what we sell, even if it was from 2011. I would like to send you a new mirror at no cost. We have also improved the pivot part so I will send you one of those as well. Just pop off the old one and replace with the new one I send you.<br /><br />Please just confirm your address and I'll have this mailed out today.<br /><br />Thanks<br /><br />Steve Parisi<br />President<br />ToiletTree Products<br /><br />Now, let me be clear, the water getting into the battery compartment was probably my fault, and I hadn't used the LED lights in a long time and the battery had leaked. The ratchet mechanism is plastic and I wasn't surprised that it had loosened. 3+ years, this unit didn't owe me anything.
