  631. This product is great though you will have to clean around the hanging bracket until you decide to remove it. It isn't so bad though because all the ones I have had that suction cupped to the wall have fallen, broken or sagged.<br /><br />Now a tip:<br />Use enough of the silicone(you may have to supply some more) so that it comes out along all the edges of the hanger. Then wipe the excess off with a paper towel or your finger to make a good seal that will not let things build up behind it.<br /><br />The only bummer is the light is not very good. Thus the 4 star rating. It has maybe ten LEDs but they don't provide any extra light unless you have a dungeon for a shower. I've had several of those and it would be ok there but not in a well lit bathroom.<br /><br />Other than that it's a great design STAYS FOG FREE unlike the treated ones and those you spray.   650. ***Update - I called customer service and they immediately shipped me out a new mirror to replace the leaky one. I just hope I don't have the same problem with the new mirror, or I'll be calling them for a replacement mirror every month.*** After reading the bad reviews, we were very careful about mounting the mirror properly so that it would not fall off the wall. The mirror worked great for about a month. It's still attached firmly to the wall. The problem we encountered is that, after a month, the water started leaking out of the reservoir. It leaks so fast that the water is gone in a couple minutes and the mirror fogs up. The water idea is great, but the reservoir needs to be one solid piece. If there is a way out, water will find it, as it has in our case. When I pay this much for a fogless shower mirror, I expect it to last a few years, not one month.

  652. I've used many different types of \\"fogless\\" shower mirrors. All of these products involve trade-offs among the triangle of Cost-Convenience-Quality factors.<br /><br />I've used the active type, which uses plumbed water to keep the mirror fog-free (works well but is pricey, and prone to breakage). I've use the treated-surface mirrors which work to varying degrees, but consistently fail withing a few months. I've also tried the heat-and-shave type that can't seem to last my entire shave. Of the ones I've tried, so far, this mirror offers the best balance of Cost, Convenience and Quality - that is, it works well, it's easy to use, and it doesn't rely on any complicated technologies to accomplish it's job, meaning it should last for a good long time.<br /><br />The ToiletTree Deluxe LED Fogless Shower Mirror offers ample mirror space and an exceptionally bright, but well distributed, light. The fogless technology is simple (warm water behind the mirror) and relies only on the same shower water that is causing the fog in the first place. The mirror includes a squeegee that works well. Though a subtlety, consistent squeegee use will extend the life of the mirror's surface. Folks with harder water, even if softened, will have particulate in the water that can accumulate on the mirror surface and \\"dim\\" the reflection over time.<br /><br />The only negative, if it can even be considered as such, is that you must manually fill and empty the reservoir behind the mirror. Still, when balanced against all of the positives, I consider this \\"negative\\" to be, at most, a minor inconvenience which I would happily take over the Cost and Quality negatives I've found in other products.<br /><br />--UPDATE 5/11/13-- I have come to appreciate this mirror even more over the last couple of months. The mirror has remained bright and clear, and the mount has remained firm. In fact this mirror has the best viewable reflection of any of the shower-shave mirrors I've used. The only \\"wear\\" visible is some minor water softener build-up.<br /><br />--UPDATE 2/27/14-- A few months ago (Oct'13), after daily use, I had a problem with the silver backing of the mirror flaking off. While the overall product was still serviceable, I felt that this should be addressed. After contacting ToiletTree via email and expressing my concerns, Kelly from ToiletTree's Marketing org contacted me arrange for a replacement mirror. I received the replacement mirror in a few days and have had no other problems since then (~4mos). If I had to score Toiletree on this issue, I'd say -1 for the minor product defect, but +5 for quickly \\"making it right\\".wear\\" visible is some minor water softener build-up.<br /><br />--UPDATE 2/27/14-- A few months ago (Oct'13), after daily use, I had a problem with the silver backing of the mirror flaking off. While the overall product was still serviceable, I felt that this should be addressed. After contacting ToiletTree via email and expressing my concerns, Kelly from ToiletTree's Marketing org contacted me arrange for a replacement mirror. I received the replacement mirror in a few days and have had no other problems since then (~4mos). If I had to score Toiletree on this issue, I'd say -1 for the minor product defect, but +5 for quickly \\"making it right\\".

  665. What a GREAT product! I started shaving in the shower about 6 months ago for the ease and closer shave that you can get by doing so. Well you get what you pay for! I went in search of a good one with a light and came across this mirror!!!! I do recommend waiting 24 hours after installing before the first use like the instructions say.<br /><br />2) The truly fog free mirror is great by running warm water into reservoir in the back of mirror. Even if you forget to fill it up when you first get started in the shower and it fogs up just take the mirror out of its cradle and fill it then. Within around 10 seconds after filling it up with the shower water the fog will disappear completely. Once you get use to using it you will remember to fill it up first thing then. I also recommend before getting out of shower to empty the water out of the reservoir because it is a little surprise if you wait till the next time you are in shower and empty the cool water out on your feet by accident. You know the wife will defiantly not like that! LOL!!!<br /><br />3) Being able to adjust the angle for multiple users is good to. The only advise I might give on this is if you adjust it be sure to use both hands and the sides and adjust it easy and one click at a time. I don't have to adjust mine, but it seems like you could damage easily by snatching and jerking on it to quick.<br /><br />4) The LED light is great also for halfway dim lit bathrooms.   674. First off, let me say how excited I was to finally find a product who's claims and reviews seemed perfect for what I was looking for. A lighted, fogless mirror for the shower. While the description did not make any false claims, the actual product isn't what I'd expect. (1) This is NOT a glass mirror but a plastic surface polished to provide a clear reflection. The problem with that is when the case is filled with water (that's how they keep it fogless) the \\"mirror\\" bends thus distorting the image. (2) the wall mount needs to be glued to the wall, This creates an issue if and when you want to remove or move the mirror's location, so be certain you put it exactly where you want it the first time. (3) the hinge to attach the mirror to the wall mount is also plastic. Thin plastic. two tiny pegs that snap in place. This creates several issues: Unless you have a showerhead on a hose, you will have to unsnap the mirror every time you attempt to use it because you have to fill the mirror's case with hot water to create the fogless environment. This mount is also supposed to make it so you can tilt the mirror, adjusting the angle up/down for better viewing. Unfortunately, the plastic is so thin and the peg is so small, these will surely break after a few attempts to remove/attach, and the weight of the water filled mirror is barely supported by the thin plastic hinge.<br /><br />Fortunately, By purchasing though Amazon, I was able to return this substandard product for a full refund.[[ASIN:B005OSQGN8 Pivoting Deluxe LED Fogless Shower Mirror with Squeegee]]

  679. I've owned many shower mirrors in the past and they all had major flaws (fog up, leak water, etc.), but this one is well thought out and overcomes all of the weaknesses of previous shower mirrors. As long as the directions are followed to the T, there shouldn't be any problems (unless the item is defective). As previously mentioned in other postings, make sure you use all of the silicon to adhere the base to the wall and the unit needs to be filled with warm/hot water otherwise it will fog up.<br /><br />Though, there is one small design issue with the mirror; the battery compartment (and I've seen others with the same problem), when I go to open it up (turning the screws to the open position), the lid does not come out -- I had to force it open and when I did very small plastic parts broke off. The mirror is still very much usable, I simply pushed the lid back on and it remains in place (just not 100% sealed). So, Steve if you are reading this, you might want to think about this when it's time for a redesign. Otherwise, I love the mirror (I've never seen my face so clear in the shower before).

This is the only reason I removed one star from this item's review. Other than that, it's perfect!

  688. I have gone through quite a few &#34;fogless&#34; mirrors and have yet to be satisfied. Most of them are great for a few weeks and then the film wears off and they are useless. This design is brilliant!!! I thought having to fill it every morning would be tedious but its not at all. Takes 2-3 secs using the shower water.   700. I have a shower with no direct light inside so a lighted mirror with fog-free capabilities was a must. I will say filling it with hot water does do the job and the squeegee is handy to help get splash marks off the face of the mirror. It mounts with both 3M adhesive tape and a tube of silicon gel and I was able to secure it to a slightly porous tile surface and it held for about 9 months and one day I came into the shower and it was in the tub. I went to the hardware store, bought more 3M tape and a tube of silicon gel and it's holding fine again. The cool thing about the silicon gel is it can be peeled off if you move or just want it gone. My son is about 4 inches taller than I and to pivot the mirror angle proved a bonus for us. I leave my razor on the shelf and typically fill the reservoir by leaving it attached to the wall as my shower head is hand held. I recommend leaving the light on until after you empty the reservoir as a reminder to do so and then switch it off. So far I haven't forgotten.<br /><br />My only gripe is the angle of the lighting. My shower is fairly dim and if I could have one change it would be to point the LED lights less toward the mirror and more toward my face so that my face is better lighted up rather than the surface of the mirror which tends to create not a steam haze but an odd reflective issue I feel would better be handled by lighting up my the face.
  701. Works good doesn't fog up
  702. I started shaving with a safety razor & I had been looking for a shaving mirror for a while but could never find one that I really liked. After some research I decided on this one. This is an excellent product & it works great. It attached to my shower wall with no trouble. All I have to do is fill the reservoir with hot water, squeegee it off with the included squeegee, turn on the led lights & shaving is breeze. If you're looking for a good shaving mirror, this one is definitely worth it. They have one that doesn't have the led lights, but I would recommend forking over the extra money to get this one.

  706. This is an excellent, well-thought out product that solves the steamy mirror issue for the shower. I didn't realize that the product needs to be filled with warm water on each use, but that has turned out to be both effective and easy. The adhesion system provided with the product is excellent. The mirror is excellent quality. I only have two wish list items for the maker of the product. First, the provided squeegy is too flexible to do a good job cleaning the water from the mirror. A better quality squeegy would be desirable (more rigid). The second is that I would rather have hooks or hangers to hang my razor than the single shelf which basically only works for one razor. Those are ideas for improvement, but neither are a reason to not buy this product.
  707. I was asked to review this product for my honest opinion. This is the best mirror I've ever used. It has battery operated LED lighting that can be used on high, low or off. The lighting in my shower is efficient enough that I don't really need to use the LED light. I like the squeege that is included to clear the water droplets away along with the shelf to sit my razor on. However the one thing that I don't really care for is that I have to fill the reservoir with warm water to keep the mirror \\"fogless\\". It has to be filled and emptied for each use. It's not that big of a deal but one more thing to add to my morning routine that I could do without. Would be better if they could make it with a fogless mirror that didn't require adding the water.Overall the assembly was easy and the directions were simple to follow.<br /><br />I received the above products through Sublime Media Connection in exchange for an honest review.   712. Being 63 and having owned homes for close to 40 years, I have owned many and various shower mirrors. I've always preferred shaving in the shower and a crystal clear mirror is a prerequisite to that end. I've had mirrors that supposedly wouldn't fog (they did). I've had mirrors that you had to apply a weekly coat of anti-fog lotion (ineffective), and I've had mirrors that soon were impossible to see my own reflection in because the mirror itself was inferior. Mind you, I always paid for the most expensive mirror available thinking that &#34;you get what you pay for&#34;. They ALL have been abyssmal failures - until now. The Deluxe LED Fogless Mirror has exceeded my expectations and is by FAR the best showere mirror I've ever owned. As I luxuriate in my very roomy shower stall with gallons of hot water flowing over me and clouds of steam fogging up the windows and door, this mirror remains crystal clear - and I mean CRYSTAL CLEAR!!!. Just take 10 seconds to fill up the back reservoir with hot shower water and you are good to go, for as long as your hot water heater allows you to stay in the shower. There's no other product out there that compares (other than the ones that require you to hire a plumber to install). Don't look any further. This is the best. PERIOD!!!

  725. I bought this about a year ago and the LEDs no longer work and it leaks now.
  726. This mirror was easy to install in our shower and it has stayed put using a combination of suction cups and a silicone adhesive, which, it is claimed, will hold the unit in place forever, but can be removed if necessary down the road. In use, one fills the reservoir with hot water from the shower, which keeps it from fogging. The built-in squeegee does the job well enough to remove most of the droplets that might collect on the mirror. The LED lights have two settings, one brighter than the other, accessed by a button on the right side when facing the unit. The user's razor can be easily stored on the shelf below the mirror. Mirror size is quite adequate and it can be tilted up or down for users of different heights. Well-designed and very useful, especially in a shower without its own lighting.
  727. The shower mirror is the best I've ever had. You won't need another one if you buy this product. Very simple installation process that works well on any shower surface.
  728. Great love it, If i were you I would buy it.
  729. My only complaint is that the mirror has a slight bow to it so if you're not right up next to the mirror then the reflection is distorted. Not a huge deal but kind of annoying.<br />I like the integrated lighting, the method for anti-fog, and the little mount underneath to hold stuff.
